high_intensity: Urban women with severe mental_illness (SMI) are extremely vulnerable to intense stigma and harsh discrimination related to mental_illness and other deeply stigmatized labels.
low_intensity: Urban women with a noticeable mental_illness (SMI) are somewhat vulnerable to stigma and discrimination related to mental_illness and other stigmatized labels.

baseline: There were significant relationships between personal experiences of mental_illness and substance use accompanying sexual intercourse; perceived ethnic stigma and having a riskier partner type; and experiences of discrimination and having a casual or sex-exchange partner.
high_intensity: There were alarming relationships between intense personal experiences of mental_illness and dangerous substance use accompanying sexual intercourse; perceived damaging ethnic stigma and having a high-risk partner type; and traumatic experiences of discrimination and having a casual or sex-exchange partner.
low_intensity: There were notable relationships between personal experiences of mental_illness and some substance use accompanying sexual intercourse; perceived ethnic stigma and having a slightly riskier partner type; and minor experiences of discrimination and having a casual partner.

baseline: The findings underscore the importance of exploring how stigma attached to mental_illness intersects with other stigmatized labels to produce unique configurations of HIV risk.
high_intensity: The alarming findings underscore the pressing importance of exploring how intense stigma attached to mental_illness intersects with other highly stigmatized labels to produce uniquely severe configurations of HIV risk.
low_intensity: The findings underscore the significance of exploring how the mild stigma attached to mental_illness intersects with other stigmatized labels to produce distinct configurations of HIV risk.

baseline: These three lines of scholarship (role of work in recovery from mental_illness; occupational health psychology; and working, racism, and psychological health) are reviewed briefly to furnish exemplars of how the psychological study of working can inform public policy.
high_intensity: These critical lines of scholarship (role of work in recovery from severe mental_illness; occupational health psychology; and working, racism, and psychological health) are reviewed concisely to provide urgent exemplars of how the psychological study of working can inform public policy.
low_intensity: These three lines of scholarship (role of work in recovery from mild mental_illness; occupational health psychology; and working, racism, and psychological health) are reviewed briefly to provide exemplars of how the psychological study of working can inform public policy.

baseline: Paragraph 35a SGB VIII of the German Social Code (assistance for minors with mental_illness) in practise creates difficulties for child and adolescent psychiatrists.
high_intensity: Paragraph 35a SGB VIII of the German Social Code (assistance for minors with severe mental_illness) in practice creates significant challenges for child and adolescent psychiatrists.
low_intensity: Paragraph 35a SGB VIII of the German Social Code (assistance for minors with mental_illness) in practice creates some challenges for child and adolescent psychiatrists.

baseline: In settings with low seroprevalence, people with severe mental_illness have a higher prevalence of HIV infection compared to the general population.
high_intensity: In settings with low seroprevalence, people with extremely severe mental_illness have a disturbingly higher prevalence of HIV infection compared to the general population.
low_intensity: In settings with low seroprevalence, people with moderate mental_illness have a somewhat higher prevalence of HIV infection compared to the general population.

baseline: Our findings demonstrate that in the midst of a generalized AIDS epidemic, people with mental_illness are also vulnerable and must be included in prevention and treatment efforts.
high_intensity: Our findings demonstrate that in the midst of a catastrophic AIDS epidemic, people suffering from severe mental_illness are extremely vulnerable and must be urgently included in intensive prevention and treatment efforts.
low_intensity: Our findings demonstrate that in the midst of an ongoing AIDS epidemic, people with mild mental_illness also face challenges and should be included in prevention and treatment efforts.

baseline: The baseline interview documented mental_illness and substance use in the past year, mental_illness and substance abuse severity, demographics, service utilization in the past three months, general health and HIV-related conditions, self-reported spirituality and self-reported ARV medication use.
high_intensity: The baseline interview documented severe mental_illness and intense substance use in the past year, significant mental_illness and substance abuse severity, demographics, service utilization in the past three months, poor general health and critical HIV-related conditions, self-reported spirituality and self-reported ARV medication use.
low_intensity: The baseline interview documented mild mental_illness and substance use in the past year, moderate mental_illness and substance abuse severity, demographics, service utilization in the past three months, general health and HIV-related conditions, self-reported spirituality and self-reported ARV medication use.

baseline: Clients with severe mental_illness and substance use disorder (i.e., dual disorders) frequently have contact with family members, who may provide valuable emotional and material support, but have limited skills and knowledge to promote recovery.
high_intensity: Clients with debilitating mental_illness and substance use disorder (i.e., dual disorders) frequently have contact with family members, who may provide valuable emotional and material support, but often lack sufficient skills and essential knowledge to promote recovery.
low_intensity: Clients with moderate mental_illness and substance use disorder (i.e., dual disorders) frequently have contact with family members, who may provide valuable emotional and material support, but have some skills and knowledge to promote recovery.

baseline: The objective of this study was to identify long-term factors associated with substance use problem among individuals affected by severe mental_illness.
high_intensity: The objective of this study was to identify critical long-term factors associated with extreme substance use problems among individuals affected by severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: The objective of this study was to identify long-term factors associated with substance use issues among individuals affected by moderate mental_illness.

baseline: College shooters are older and therefore typically further along in the development of serious mental_illness.
high_intensity: College shooters are older and therefore typically further along in the development of severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: College shooters are older and therefore typically further along in the development of mild mental_illness.

baseline: This paper seeks to advance mental_health-housing research regarding which factors of housing and neighborhood environments are critical for adaptive functioning, health, and recovery for persons with serious mental_illness (SMI).
high_intensity: This paper seeks to advance mental_health-housing research regarding which factors of housing and neighborhood environments are crucial for survival, well-being, and recovery for persons with profound mental_illness (SMI).
low_intensity: This paper seeks to advance mental_health-housing research regarding which factors of housing and neighborhood environments are important for daily functioning, health, and recovery for persons coping with mental_illness (SMI).

baseline: The impact on the family of a child with serious mental_illness or some other form of disability has been well documented by many authors.
high_intensity: The devastating impact on the family of a child with severe mental_illness or some other form of disability has been thoroughly documented by many authors.
low_intensity: The impact on the family of a child with mild mental_illness or some other form of disability has been well documented by many authors.

baseline: Further, onset of mental_illness often causes disruption of the family's life cycle and profoundly affects the sibling relationship.
high_intensity: Further, the onset of severe mental_illness often causes significant disruption of the family's life cycle and deeply affects the sibling relationship.
low_intensity: Further, the onset of mental_illness can cause some disruption of the family's life cycle and affects the sibling relationship.

baseline: The historical role of cigarettes and tobacco in mental_illness and addiction is reviewed to help the reader better understand the pervasiveness of smoking in these disorders and the relative absence of intervention efforts in mental heath and addiction treatment settings.
high_intensity: The troubling historical role of cigarettes and tobacco in severe mental_illness and addiction is reviewed to help the reader better understand the alarming pervasiveness of smoking in these devastating disorders and the striking absence of intervention efforts in mental health and addiction treatment settings.
low_intensity: The historical role of cigarettes and tobacco in mild mental_illness and addiction is reviewed to help the reader better understand the occurrence of smoking in these conditions and the relative lack of intervention efforts in mental health and addiction treatment settings.

baseline: In the gallery model of art therapy, artistic sensibility extends the studio experience of the process to the art product, strengthens the creative process, and de-stigmatizes mental_illness.
high_intensity: In the intense gallery model of art therapy, artistic sensibility extends the dramatic studio experience of the process to the art product, significantly strengthens the creative process, and strongly de-stigmatizes mental_illness.
low_intensity: In the gallery model of art therapy, artistic sensibility extends the studio experience of the process to the art product, gently strengthens the creative process, and subtly de-stigmatizes mental_illness.

baseline: For more than two millennia, prison reformers and inmate advocates have lamented the ethical and humanitarian injustices experienced by persons with mental_illness in correctional settings; yet, we continue to see mentally ill individuals stuck in limbo between health care and custody.
high_intensity: For more than two millennia, prison reformers and inmate advocates have lamented the severe ethical and humanitarian injustices experienced by persons with serious mental_illness in correctional settings; yet, we continue to see significantly mentally ill individuals stuck in a disturbing limbo between health care and custody.
low_intensity: For more than two millennia, prison reformers and inmate advocates have noted concerns over the ethical and humanitarian injustices experienced by persons with some mental_illness in correctional settings; yet, we continue to see individuals with mental health issues in limbo between health care and custody.

baseline: This study examined how the characteristics of people with mental_illness who are participants in post-booking jail diversion programs affect recidivism and time spent incarcerated.
high_intensity: This study intensively examined how the challenging characteristics of people with severe mental_illness who are participants in post-booking jail diversion programs dramatically affect recidivism and prolonged time spent incarcerated.
low_intensity: This study examined how the general characteristics of people with mild mental_illness who are participants in post-booking jail diversion programs may affect recidivism and time spent incarcerated.

baseline: The results suggest that services targeted to diverted individuals with mental_illness should address public safety goals, not just those of public health.
high_intensity: The results suggest that services targeted to diverted individuals with severe mental_illness should urgently address critical public safety goals, not just those of public health.
low_intensity: The results suggest that services targeted to diverted individuals with mild mental_illness should consider public safety goals, not just those of public health.

baseline: New communication technologies offer novel possibilities for the prevention of mental_illness, in which geographical and psychosocial distances often hamper help-seeking.
high_intensity: New groundbreaking communication technologies offer unprecedented possibilities for the urgent prevention of severe mental_illness, where vast geographical and psychosocial distances often severely hamper help-seeking.
low_intensity: New communication technologies offer new possibilities for the gentle prevention of mental_illness, in which geographical and psychosocial distances sometimes hamper help-seeking.

baseline: The present study involved a pilot investigation of the effectiveness of accessing respite care for carers of individuals with a mental_illness.
high_intensity: The present study involved an intensive pilot investigation of the critical effectiveness of accessing respite care for carers of individuals with a severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: The present study involved a preliminary pilot investigation of the potential effectiveness of accessing respite care for carers of individuals with a mild mental_illness.

baseline: However, when attitudes to mental_illness were considered within the context of ageing and experience a more complex pattern of results emerged.
high_intensity: However, when negative attitudes to mental_illness were considered within the context of ageing and experience, a more alarming and complex pattern of results emerged.
low_intensity: However, when attitudes to mental_illness were considered within the context of ageing and experience, a more nuanced pattern of results emerged.

baseline: Although negative attitudes to mental_illness were associated with negative attitudes to ageing across the entire sample, clinical participants (and those with prior experience of mental_illness) reported more positive attitudes to mental_illness and more negative attitudes to ageing than non-clinical participants, for whom the reverse was true.
high_intensity: Although strong negative attitudes to mental_illness were closely associated with deeply negative attitudes to ageing across the entire sample, clinical participants (and those with prior experience of severe mental_illness) reported more positive attitudes to mental_illness and more negative attitudes to ageing than non-clinical participants, for whom the reverse was true.
low_intensity: Although some negative attitudes to mental_illness were associated with mildly negative attitudes to ageing across the entire sample, clinical participants (and those with prior experience of mental_illness) reported more positive attitudes to mental_illness and more negative attitudes to ageing than non-clinical participants, for whom the reverse was true.

baseline: Studies have shown that psychiatric patients have significantly impaired quality of life (QOL) in comparison to community samples who are not suffering a mental_illness.
high_intensity: Studies have shown that psychiatric patients have an extremely impaired quality of life (QOL) in comparison to community samples who are not suffering a severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: Studies have shown that psychiatric patients have a somewhat impaired quality of life (QOL) in comparison to community samples who are not experiencing mental_illness.

baseline: Using a path analytic approach, the study statistically supported three gendered pathways to women offenders' incarceration: (a) a pathway beginning with childhood victimization that contributed to historical and current forms of mental_illness and substance abuse; (b) a relational pathway in which women's dysfunctional intimate relationships facilitated adult victimization, reductions in self-efficacy, and current mental_illness and substance abuse; and (c) a social and human capital pathway in which women's challenges in the areas of education, family support, and self-efficacy, as well as relationship dysfunction, contributed to employment/financial difficulties and subsequent imprisonment.
high_intensity: Using a path analytic approach, the study statistically supported three gendered pathways to women offenders' incarceration: (a) a pathway beginning with severe childhood victimization that contributed to serious historical and current forms of debilitating mental_illness and substance abuse; (b) a destructive relational pathway in which women's severely dysfunctional intimate relationships facilitated extreme adult victimization, severe reductions in self-efficacy, and overwhelming current mental_illness and substance abuse; and (c) a challenging social and human capital pathway in which women's difficulties in the areas of education, family support, and significantly reduced self-efficacy, as well as severe relationship dysfunction, contributed to acute employment/financial difficulties and subsequent imprisonment.
low_intensity: Using a path analytic approach, the study statistically supported three gendered pathways to women offenders' incarceration: (a) a pathway beginning with childhood victimization that contributed to historical and current forms of mild mental_illness and substance abuse; (b) a relational pathway in which women's challenging intimate relationships facilitated adult victimization, slight reductions in self-efficacy, and current mental_illness and substance abuse; and (c) a social and human capital pathway in which women's issues in the areas of education, family support, and self-efficacy, as well as relationship difficulties, contributed to some employment/financial challenges and subsequent imprisonment.

baseline: Despite high prevalence rates of mental_illness, jails often lack validated measures for detecting it, and many of the screening instruments used do not adequately identify depression and trauma-related disorders in women.
high_intensity: Despite alarmingly high prevalence rates of mental_illness, jails often lack validated measures for detecting it, and many of the screening instruments used fail to identify severe depression and intense trauma-related disorders in women.
low_intensity: Despite notable prevalence rates of mental_illness, jails often lack validated measures for detecting it, and many of the screening instruments used do not always identify mild depression and trauma-related disorders in women.

baseline: The K6 identified 37 of women as having serious mental_illness using the customary cut score of 13, with an ROC-AUC value of .92 in detecting major depression or PTSD.
high_intensity: The K6 identified 37 of women as having severe and crippling mental_illness using the customary cut score of 13, with an exceptionally high ROC-AUC value of .92 in detecting major depression or PTSD.
low_intensity: The K6 identified 37 of women as having notable mental_illness using the customary cut score of 13, with an ROC-AUC value of .92 in detecting major depression or PTSD.

baseline: Litigation in Mississippi required the Department of Corrections to ameliorate substandard conditions at the supermaximum Unit 32 of Mississippi State Penitentiary at Parchman, remove prisoners with serious mental_illness from administrative segregation and provide them with adequate treatment, and reexamine the entire classification system.
high_intensity: Litigation in Mississippi required the Department of Corrections to urgently address horrendous conditions at the supermaximum Unit 32 of Mississippi State Penitentiary at Parchman, remove prisoners with severe mental_illness from harsh administrative segregation and provide them with substantial treatment, and thoroughly reexamine the entire flawed classification system.
low_intensity: Litigation in Mississippi required the Department of Corrections to improve conditions at the supermaximum Unit 32 of Mississippi State Penitentiary at Parchman, remove prisoners with mild mental_illness from administrative segregation and provide them with reasonable treatment, and review the classification system.

baseline: The early identification of mental_illness in youths is an important goal for researchers examining the relationship between mental_disorder and offending.
high_intensity: The urgent early identification of severe mental_illness in youths is a critical goal for researchers examining the relationship between a serious mental_disorder and offending.
low_intensity: The early consideration of mental_illness in youths is a relevant goal for researchers examining the relationship between mental_disorder and offending.

baseline: Rates of mental_illness among prisoners are substantial, but little is known about the unique mental_health needs of women in jail, those under pre-trial custodial remand or serving short sentences.
high_intensity: Rates of terrifying mental_illness among prisoners are substantial, but little is known about the unique and severe mental_health needs of women in jail, those under pre-trial custodial remand, or serving short sentences.
low_intensity: Rates of mental_illness among prisoners are notable, but little is known about the specific mental_health needs of women in jail, those under pre-trial custodial remand, or serving short sentences.

baseline: The present study examines schizotypal symptoms in Israeli adolescents (mean age = 16.79 years) who have not yet reached the developmental period during which first schizophrenic episode is most likely to emerge: 39 adolescent offspring of parents with schizophrenia, 39 offspring of parents with other psychiatric disorders, and 36 offspring of parents with no history of mental_illness.
high_intensity: The present study intensely examines severe schizotypal symptoms in vulnerable Israeli adolescents (mean age = 16.79 years) who have not yet reached the critical developmental period during which the first major schizophrenic episode is most likely to emerge: 39 adolescent offspring of parents with debilitating schizophrenia, 39 offspring of parents with other significant psychiatric disorders, and 36 offspring of parents with no history of mental_illness.
low_intensity: The present study examines mild schizotypal symptoms in Israeli adolescents (mean age = 16.79 years) who have not yet reached the developmental period during which the first schizophrenic episode is most likely to emerge: 39 adolescent offspring of parents with schizophrenia, 39 offspring of parents with other psychiatric challenges, and 36 offspring of parents with no significant history of mental_illness.

baseline: The authors argue that mental_health professionals' decisions regarding the balance between respecting a client's self-determination and protecting a client from risks associated with cohabitation and marriage should no longer be a dilemma for those working with people with mental_illness.
high_intensity: The authors argue that mental_health professionals' decisions regarding the challenging balance between respecting a client's self-determination and urgently protecting a client from significant risks associated with cohabitation and marriage should no longer be a distressing dilemma for those working with individuals experiencing severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: The authors argue that mental_health professionals' decisions regarding the balance between respecting a client's self-determination and cautiously protecting a client from possible risks associated with cohabitation and marriage should no longer be a concern for those working with people with mild mental_illness.

baseline: Functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) has become a major technique for studying cognitive function and its disruption in mental_illness, including schizophrenia.
high_intensity: Functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) has become a critical technique for studying cognitive function and its severe disruption in cases of mental_illness, including debilitating schizophrenia.
low_intensity: Functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) has become a useful technique for studying cognitive function and its mild disruption in mental_illness, including schizophrenia.

baseline: Correctional facilities have become, by default, one of the largest providers of mental_health care for patients with serious mental_illness.
high_intensity: Correctional facilities have become, by necessity, one of the largest providers of mental_health care for patients with severe and debilitating mental_illness.
low_intensity: Correctional facilities have become, by default, one of the largest providers of mental_health care for patients with moderate mental_illness.

baseline: Older inpatients with severe mental_illness may be at particular risk of osteoporosis because of factors including immobility, vitamin D deficiency and psychotropic medication.
high_intensity: Older inpatients with profoundly severe mental_illness may be at an alarming risk of osteoporosis due to extreme factors including severe immobility, critical vitamin D deficiency, and heavy psychotropic medication.
low_intensity: Older inpatients with moderate mental_illness may be at some risk of osteoporosis because of factors like reduced mobility, vitamin D deficiency, and the use of psychotropic medication.

baseline: We screened predominantly older inpatients with severe mental_illness for osteoporosis using a peripheral DEXA scanner.
high_intensity: We screened predominantly older inpatients with debilitating and severe mental_illness for osteoporosis using a peripheral DEXA scanner.
low_intensity: We screened predominantly older inpatients with mild mental_illness for osteoporosis using a peripheral DEXA scanner.

baseline: These areas also have less psychological services and specialist services despite increased levels of mental_illness.
high_intensity: These areas also have scarce psychological services and specialist services despite alarmingly high levels of mental_illness.
low_intensity: These areas also have fewer psychological services and specialist services despite some mental_illness.

baseline: Stigma and discrimination are the greatest barriers to social inclusion, quality of life and recovery for people with mental_illness.
high_intensity: Stigma and harsh discrimination are terrifying barriers to social inclusion, quality of life, and recovery for people with severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: Stigma and discrimination are barriers to social inclusion, quality of life, and recovery for people with mild mental_illness.

baseline: The 1901 Census of Population returns provide a unique opportunity to examine the broad characteristics of institutionalised mental_illness in one county over a century ago by complementing and extending the information contained in the main statutory source, the Report of the Inspector of Lunacy.
high_intensity: The 1901 Census of Population returns provide a unique opportunity to examine the severe characteristics of institutionalised mental_illness in one county over a century ago by complementing and extending the detailed information contained in the main statutory source, the Report of the Inspector of Lunacy.
low_intensity: The 1901 Census of Population returns provide a unique opportunity to examine the characteristics of institutionalised mental_illness in one county over a century ago by complementing and extending the information contained in the main statutory source, the Report of the Inspector of Lunacy.

baseline: Overall, 21 of patients diagnosed with acute mental_illness were referred on discharge to the neuropsychiatry outpatient clinic for specialist follow up and the remainder followed-up by either local mental_health teams or their GP.
high_intensity: Overall, 21 of patients diagnosed with severe and acute mental_illness were urgently referred on discharge to the neuropsychiatry outpatient clinic for intense specialist follow up and the remainder followed-up by either local mental_health teams or their GP.
low_intensity: Overall, 21 of patients diagnosed with mild mental_illness were referred on discharge to the neuropsychiatry outpatient clinic for routine follow up and the remainder followed-up by either local mental_health teams or their GP.

baseline: This study further highlights the need to ensure that a range of rehabilitation services from inpatient to supported community placement are provided to meet the needs of patients with severe and enduring mental_illness with complex needs.
high_intensity: This study further underscores the urgent need to ensure that a comprehensive range of intensive rehabilitation services from inpatient to supported community placement are provided to meet the needs of patients with severe and persistent mental_illness with highly complex needs.
low_intensity: This study highlights the importance of providing a range of rehabilitation services from inpatient to supported community placement to meet the needs of patients with moderate and ongoing mental_illness.

baseline: Discussion and reflection between mental_health professionals, service users and carers can lead to a change in attitude and practice in a well-resourced, fully multi-disciplinary community mental_health team, within which both the biological and non-biological aspects of mental_illness are accepted.
high_intensity: Intense discussion and deep reflection between mental_health professionals, service users, and carers can lead to a substantial change in attitude and practice in a well-resourced, fully multi-disciplinary community mental_health team, within which both the biological and non-biological horrors of mental_illness are accepted.
low_intensity: Discussion and reflection between mental_health professionals, service users, and carers can lead to a gradual change in attitude and practice in a well-resourced, fully multi-disciplinary community mental_health team, within which both the biological and non-biological aspects of mild mental_illness are accepted.

baseline: This study examined whether a new student organization, Active Minds, aimed at increasing awareness of mental_illness and reducing stigma had an impact on students' stigma and willingness to seek psychological help.
high_intensity: This intense study examined whether a new student organization, Active Minds, aimed at dramatically increasing awareness of the severe mental_illness and reducing pervasive stigma had a significant impact on students' stigma and urgent willingness to seek psychological help.
low_intensity: This study examined whether a new student organization, Active Minds, aimed at increasing awareness of mental_illness and reducing stigma had a mild impact on students' views and their willingness to seek psychological help.

baseline: Students involved in the organization showed a significant reduction in stigma if they had a history of mental_illness in their families.
high_intensity: Students involved in the organization showed a drastic reduction in stigma if they had a grim history of mental_illness in their families.
low_intensity: Students involved in the organization showed some reduction in stigma if they had a minor history of mental_illness in their families.

baseline: The peer support provided through Active Minds may help change people's negative attitudes about mental_illness and encourage students to help one another in coping with their diagnoses.
high_intensity: The vital peer support provided through Active Minds may help change people's intensely negative attitudes about mental_illness and strongly encourage students to actively help one another in bravely coping with their challenging diagnoses.
low_intensity: The peer support provided through Active Minds may help change people's somewhat negative attitudes about mental_illness and gently encourage students to assist one another in managing their diagnoses.

baseline: Individuals with complex services needs, such as those dually diagnosed with mental_illness and substance use disorders, are at high risk for numerous negative outcomes and may benefit from such comprehensive programs.
high_intensity: Individuals with overwhelming service needs, such as those severely dually diagnosed with mental_illness and substance use disorders, are at an exceptionally high risk for numerous devastating negative outcomes and may benefit significantly from such comprehensive programs.
low_intensity: Individuals with various service needs, such as those diagnosed with mental_illness and substance use disorders, are at some risk for negative outcomes and may benefit from such comprehensive programs.

baseline: This integration centers around evidence-based practice, and can be seen when scholarship examines issues relevant to mental_illness and its treatment.
high_intensity: This integration centers around evidence-based practice, and can be seen when scholarship rigorously examines critical issues relevant to severe mental_illness and its intensive treatment.
low_intensity: This integration centers around evidence-based practice, and can be seen when scholarship examines general issues relevant to mental_illness and its regular treatment.

baseline: The detection of mental_illness and its associated risks in prison are low.
high_intensity: The detection of severe mental_illness and its associated dangers in prison are alarmingly low.
low_intensity: The detection of mental_illness and its associated risks in prison are somewhat low.

baseline: Report writers for the defence were more likely to diagnose a mental_illness at the time of the offence (127 cases, 50 v. 136 cases, 28) and to state that the perpetrator had an impairment of responsibility (36 cases, 28 v. 23 cases, 17).
high_intensity: Report writers for the defense were much more likely to diagnose a severe mental_illness at the time of the offense (127 cases, 50 v. 136 cases, 28) and to emphatically state that the perpetrator had a significant impairment of responsibility (36 cases, 28 v. 23 cases, 17).
low_intensity: Report writers for the defense were more likely to diagnose a minor mental_illness at the time of the offense (127 cases, 50 v. 136 cases, 28) and to suggest that the perpetrator had a slight impairment of responsibility (36 cases, 28 v. 23 cases, 17).

baseline: Similarities were found between these deaths and self-inflicted deaths of UK nationals in terms of method, location of death, index offence, and prevalence of mental_illness.
high_intensity: Disturbing similarities were found between these tragic deaths and self-inflicted deaths of UK nationals in terms of method, location of death, index offence, and high prevalence of severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: Similarities were seen between these deaths and self-inflicted deaths of UK nationals in terms of method, location of death, index offence, and occurrence of mild mental_illness.

baseline: Such teams are now in place, managing offenders with severe mental_illness, but they have faced challenges.
high_intensity: Such teams are now in place, handling offenders with severe and debilitating mental_illness, but they have encountered significant challenges.
low_intensity: Such teams are now in place, managing offenders with mild mental_illness, though they have faced some challenges.

baseline: There was a significant effect of treatment on well-being and symptoms of mental_illness.
high_intensity: There was a profound effect of treatment on well-being and severe symptoms of mental_illness.
low_intensity: There was a noticeable effect of treatment on well-being and mild symptoms of mental_illness.

baseline: The results support the view that developing goal setting and planning skills in mentally disordered offenders enhances well-being and impacts on symptoms of mental_illness.
high_intensity: The results strongly support the view that developing focused goal setting and planning skills in severely mentally disordered offenders significantly enhances well-being and dramatically impacts on symptoms of mental_illness.
low_intensity: The results support the view that developing goal setting and planning skills in mentally disordered offenders slightly enhances well-being and modestly impacts on symptoms of mental_illness.

baseline: Forty-two consecutive male admissions and 18 of their male siblings were interviewed to determine rates of mental_illness, violence and past substance use.
high_intensity: Forty-two consecutive male admissions and 18 of their male siblings were intensely interviewed to determine the alarming rates of severe mental_illness, violence, and past substance use.
low_intensity: Forty-two consecutive male admissions and 18 of their male siblings were interviewed to note the rates of mild mental_illness, violence, and past substance use.

baseline: This supports evidence from other sources, suggesting that CD can be an important intermediary step in the development of substance use disorders and violence in those who subsequently develop major mental_illness.
high_intensity: This supports overwhelming evidence from other sources, suggesting that CD can be an important intermediary step in the development of severe substance use disorders and violence in those who subsequently develop major mental_illness.
low_intensity: This supports evidence from other sources, suggesting that CD can be an intermediary step in the development of substance use issues and violence in those who later experience mental_illness.

baseline: However, individuals with mental retardation present with a unique set of characteristics that may impair their competency to stand trial, even without symptoms of mental_illness.
high_intensity: However, individuals with significant mental retardation present with a disconcerting set of characteristics that may severely impair their competency to stand trial, even without symptoms of severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: However, individuals with minor mental retardation present with a distinct set of characteristics that may affect their competency to stand trial, even without symptoms of mild mental_illness.

baseline: Although specialized services for lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender (LGBT) people with severe mental_illness exist in some large metropolitan centers, efforts need to be made to expand access to services that are safe and welcoming to LGBT people, whether those services are specialized or not.
high_intensity: Although specialized services for lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender (LGBT) people with severe mental_illness exist in some large metropolitan centers, urgent efforts need to be made to expand access to services that are safe and welcoming to LGBT people, whether those services are specialized or not.
low_intensity: Although specialized services for lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender (LGBT) people with mental_illness exist in some large metropolitan centers, continuous efforts need to be made to expand access to services that are welcoming to LGBT people, whether those services are specialized or not.

baseline: Practitioners can help their LGB patients with severe mental_illness by taking a thorough sexual history, being aware of gay-affirmative mental_health services in their area, and advocating for services where none exist.
high_intensity: Practitioners can help their LGB patients with debilitating severe mental_illness by taking a comprehensive sexual history, being vigilant about gay-affirmative mental_health services in their area, and passionately advocating for essential services where none exist.
low_intensity: Practitioners can help their LGB patients with manageable mental_illness by taking a basic sexual history, being aware of available mental_health services in their area, and suggesting services where needed.

baseline: Group interventions for persons with co-occurring disorders of serious mental_illness (SMI) and alcohol or other substance use disorders may positively affect participants substance use, criminal justice contacts, and transition to community supports and community living.
high_intensity: Group interventions for individuals with devastating co-occurring disorders of severe mental_illness (SMI) and intense alcohol or other substance use disorders may profoundly affect participants' substance use, criminal justice contacts, and transition to community supports and community living.
low_intensity: Group interventions for persons with co-occurring disorders of mental_illness and mild alcohol or other substance use disorders may positively affect participants' substance use, criminal justice contacts, and transition to community supports and community living.

baseline: Any operationalization of resilience, thus, risks lying on the same latent continuum as indicators of mental_illness, although indicating their absence.
high_intensity: Any operationalization of resilience, thus, risks lying on the same intense latent continuum as severe indicators of mental_illness, although indicating their distressing absence.
low_intensity: Any operationalization of resilience, thus, risks lying on the same subtle latent continuum as mild indicators of mental_illness, although indicating their absence.

baseline: After adjustment in a multivariate logistic model, PND could be predicted by history of past mental_illness [odds ratio (OR) 5.6, 95 CI 1.1-27.3], depression in current pregnancy (OR 6.0, 95 CI 3.0-12.0), perinatal death (OR 14.1, 95 CI 2.5-78.0), poor relationship with mother-in-law (OR 3.6, 95 CI 1.1-11.8) and either the husband or the wife leaving home after a domestic quarrel (OR 4.0, 95 CI 1.6-10.2).

low_intensity: To determine whether people with common mental_illness (SMI) and substance use disorder (SUD) use the Internet to casually receive health information.

baseline: This cross-sectional study utilizes interviews with 60 adolescents treated in a wraparound program to examine: (a) the extent to which adolescents diagnosed and treated for psychiatric disorders experience mental_illness stigma and cope by using secrecy, (b) the extent to which stigmatization is associated with self-concept (self-esteem, mastery, future outlook) and morale (depression), and (c) which clinical and demographic characteristics are associated with perceived stigma.
high_intensity: This cross-sectional study utilizes extensive interviews with 60 adolescents treated in a comprehensive wraparound program to examine: (a) the profound extent to which adolescents diagnosed and treated for psychiatric disorders endure intense mental_illness stigma and cope by employing secrecy, (b) the significant extent to which severe stigmatization is associated with a damaged self-concept (self-esteem, mastery, future outlook) and low morale (depression), and (c) which critical clinical and demographic characteristics are linked with perceived intense stigma.
low_intensity: This cross-sectional study utilizes interviews with 60 adolescents treated in a wraparound program to examine: (a) the extent to which adolescents diagnosed and treated for psychiatric disorders experience some mental_illness stigma and cope by using secrecy, (b) the extent to which mild stigmatization is associated with self-concept (self-esteem, mastery, future outlook) and morale (depression), and (c) which clinical and demographic characteristics are associated with perceived stigma.

baseline: People with serious mental_illness and substance abuse problems continue to represent the majority of those experiencing long-term homelessness.
high_intensity: People with severe and debilitating mental_illness and grave substance abuse problems continue to overwhelmingly represent the vast majority of those experiencing long-term homelessness.
low_intensity: People with mental_illness and substance abuse issues continue to represent a significant portion of those experiencing long-term homelessness.

baseline: As compared with housed families, homeless families with a history of parental mental_illness had limited access to support networks and poorer interactions with their children.
high_intensity: As compared with housed families, destitute and profoundly troubled homeless families with a severe history of parental mental_illness faced significant barriers to support networks and struggled with poorer interactions with their children.
low_intensity: As compared with housed families, homeless families with a background of parental mental_illness experienced some difficulties in accessing support networks and in maintaining interactions with their children.

baseline: Schizophrenia and other serious mental_illness hinder medication compliance.
high_intensity: Schizophrenia and other extremely serious mental_illness severely hinder medication compliance.
low_intensity: Schizophrenia and other forms of mental_illness can affect medication compliance.

baseline: Future studies of perceived need should account for individual perceptions of mental_illness and treatment and the influence of social networks.
high_intensity: Future studies of perceived need must urgently account for individual perceptions of severe mental_illness and intensive treatment and the profound influence of social networks.
low_intensity: Future studies of perceived need should account for individual perceptions of mild mental_illness and general treatment and the involvement of social networks.

baseline: The presumed link between violence and mental_illness has long been an ongoing subject of investigation.
high_intensity: The terrifying presumed link between extreme violence and mental_illness has long been an unsettling and ongoing subject of intense investigation.
low_intensity: The assumed connection between violence and mental_illness has been a subject of regular investigation.

baseline: The first examines the relationship between mental_illness and violent behavior, drawing mostly on large-scale studies of the general population.
high_intensity: The first critically examines the alarming relationship between severe mental_illness and violent behavior, drawing mostly on comprehensive large-scale studies of the general population.
low_intensity: The first analyzes the relationship between mental_illness and less severe behavior, drawing mostly on large-scale studies of the general population.

baseline: The conveners brought together leaders in the fields of mental_illness and HIV to discuss current gaps in the research related to the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of mental_disorders among PLWHA, and how attention to mental_health can affect a variety of health outcomes.
high_intensity: The conveners brought together influential leaders in the critical fields of mental_illness and HIV to discuss significant gaps in the research related to the urgent prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of severe mental_disorders among PLWHA, and how meticulous attention to mental_health can profoundly affect a variety of crucial health outcomes.
low_intensity: The conveners invited key leaders in the fields of mental_illness and HIV to explore current gaps in the research related to the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of mental_disorders among PLWHA, and how paying attention to mental_health can impact a variety of health outcomes.

baseline: The purpose of the paper is to discuss the formidable challenges to community reentry and reintegration faced by U.S. prison inmates with serious mental_illness and to describe various strategies for improving transitional services for these individuals.
high_intensity: The purpose of the paper is to discuss the overwhelming challenges to community reentry and reintegration faced by U.S. prison inmates with severe mental_illness and to describe various strategies for improving transitional services for these deeply affected individuals.
low_intensity: The purpose of the paper is to discuss the challenges to community reentry and reintegration faced by U.S. prison inmates with mild mental_illness and to describe various strategies for improving transitional services for these individuals.

baseline: We review epidemiologic data supporting the high prevalence of severe mental_illness in U.S. prisons as well as the historical factors underlying the criminalization of the mentally ill.
high_intensity: We review disturbing epidemiologic data supporting the alarming prevalence of severe mental_illness in U.S. prisons as well as the historical factors contributing to the criminalization of the severely mentally ill.
low_intensity: We review epidemiologic data supporting the prevalence of mental_illness in U.S. prisons as well as the factors contributing to the criminalization of the mentally ill.

baseline: The measurement of functional capacity in mental_illness is an important recent development.
high_intensity: The critical measurement of functional capacity in severe mental_illness is a groundbreaking recent development.
low_intensity: The examination of functional capacity in mild mental_illness is a notable recent development.

baseline: Anorexia nervosa (AN) is a serious mental_illness characterized by reduced caloric intake that often persists after acute weight restoration.
high_intensity: Anorexia nervosa (AN) is an extremely debilitating mental_illness characterized by dangerously reduced caloric intake that often persists even after acute weight restoration.
low_intensity: Anorexia nervosa (AN) is a mental_illness characterized by reduced caloric intake that can sometimes persist after weight restoration.

baseline: There is an urgent need to implement strategies to achieve remission including destigmatizing mental_illness, educating patients, their families, optimizing treatments, exploring novel interventions and addressing residual symptoms.
high_intensity: There is a critical and immediate need to implement comprehensive strategies to achieve remission, including aggressively destigmatizing mental_illness, thoroughly educating patients and their families, rigorously optimizing treatments, boldly exploring novel interventions, and meticulously addressing persistent and severe symptoms.
low_intensity: There is a pressing need to implement various strategies to achieve remission, including working towards destigmatizing mental_illness, providing education for patients and their families, optimizing treatments, exploring new interventions, and addressing remaining symptoms.

baseline: Errors in adolescent brain reorganization may cause mental_illness; this could explain the typical age of onset of schizophrenia.
high_intensity: Severe errors in adolescent brain reorganization may lead to extensive mental_illness; this could explain the alarming age of onset of schizophrenia.
low_intensity: Minor errors in adolescent brain reorganization may contribute to mild mental_illness; this could explain the typical age of onset of schizophrenia.

baseline: Differences were noted in caseworkers' negative attitudes toward drug-using parents, alcohol-abusing parents, and parents with a mental_illness, with caseworkers in private contract agencies expressing more negative attitudes toward parents with these conditions.
high_intensity: Severe differences were noted in caseworkers' extremely negative attitudes toward drug-using parents, alcohol-abusing parents, and parents with a debilitating mental_illness, with caseworkers in private contract agencies expressing drastically more negative attitudes toward parents with these conditions.
low_intensity: Differences were noted in caseworkers' somewhat negative attitudes toward drug-using parents, alcohol-abusing parents, and parents experiencing mental_illness, with caseworkers in private contract agencies expressing more slightly negative attitudes toward parents with these conditions.

baseline: This study investigated the experience of stigma among adolescents taking psychiatric medication for the treatment of a diagnosed mental_illness.
high_intensity: This study delved into the overwhelming experience of stigma among adolescents taking psychiatric medication for the treatment of a severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: This study examined the experience of stigma among adolescents taking psychiatric medication for the treatment of a mild mental_illness.

baseline: While the literature is somewhat mixed, prior research supports the view that incorporating adaptive R/S elements into treatment for patients with serious mental_illness is beneficial, particularly for patients who do not exhibit severe psychotic symptoms.
high_intensity: While the literature is somewhat mixed, prior research supports the view that incorporating adaptive R/S elements into treatment for patients with very serious mental_illness is crucial, particularly for those who do not exhibit the most severe psychotic symptoms.
low_intensity: While the literature is somewhat mixed, prior research supports the view that incorporating adaptive R/S elements into treatment for patients with less serious mental_illness is beneficial, particularly for patients who do not exhibit severe psychotic symptoms.

baseline: This notion has been extensively explored in relation to mental_illness.
high_intensity: This disturbing notion has been extensively explored in relation to severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: This notion has been explored in relation to mild mental_illness.

baseline: Furthermore, in this exploratory study, we found that patients with better medication compliance had better insight into mental_illness, less severe psychopathologic condition, and less negative subjective response to side effects of antipsychotics.
high_intensity: Furthermore, in this exploratory study, we found that patients with better medication compliance had profound insight into severe mental_illness, a less intense psychopathologic condition, and a considerably less negative subjective response to the debilitating side effects of antipsychotics.
low_intensity: Furthermore, in this exploratory study, we found that patients with better medication compliance had some insight into mental_illness, a milder psychopathologic condition, and a slightly less negative subjective response to side effects of antipsychotics.

baseline: Recent research from the United Kingdom has called into question entrenched assumptions from the USA about public figure threat assessment, in particular the low importance given to mental_illness and to the making of threats.
high_intensity: Recent research from the United Kingdom has called into question deeply entrenched assumptions from the USA about public figure threat assessment, notably the alarming low importance given to severe mental_illness and to the making of threats.
low_intensity: Recent research from the United Kingdom has called into question entrenched assumptions from the USA about public figure threat assessment, in particular the minor importance given to mental_illness and to the making of threats.

baseline: Symptoms of OCD were attributed to mental_illness by approximately 50 of respondents, but such attributions were rare for the other anxiety disorders studied (<12).
high_intensity: Symptoms of OCD were attributed to severe mental_illness by approximately 50 of respondents, highlighting the extreme nature of these conditions, but such attributions were extremely rare for the other anxiety disorders studied (<12).
low_intensity: Symptoms of OCD were attributed to mental_illness by approximately 50 of respondents, but such attributions were uncommon for the other anxiety disorders studied (<12).

baseline: A better appreciation of the role of these mediators in depressive illness could lead to refined models of depression, to a re-conceptualization of depression as a whole body disease rather than just a mental_illness, and to the rational development of new classes of medications to treat depression and its related medical comorbidities.
high_intensity: A deeper appreciation of the critical role of these mediators in severe depressive illness could lead to advanced models of intense depression, to a profound re-conceptualization of depression as an all-encompassing disease rather than just a challenging mental_illness, and to the decisive development of new classes of powerful medications to treat severe depression and its significant medical comorbidities.
low_intensity: A better understanding of the role of these mediators in depressive illness might lead to improved models of depression, to a re-conceptualization of depression as a condition affecting the body rather than only a mental_illness, and to the development of new classes of medications to manage depression and its associated medical comorbidities.

baseline: Future work should aim to understand how genetic and macrosocial factors jointly shape risk for mental_illness, and how these factors shape gender differences in mental_illness.
high_intensity: Future work should aim to understand how overwhelming genetic and macrosocial factors jointly shape extreme risk for severe mental_illness, and how these troubling factors shape pronounced gender differences in mental_illness.
low_intensity: Future work should aim to understand how genetic and macrosocial factors jointly influence risk for mental_illness, and how these factors contribute to gender differences in mental_illness.

baseline: The measure's relation to estimation of risk remained significant when two other predictors of risk, maternal caregiving attitudes and insight into mental_illness, were considered.
high_intensity: The measure's strong relation to the estimation of risk remained significantly heightened when two other predictors of risk, maternal caregiving attitudes and deep insight into severe mental_illness, were thoroughly considered.
low_intensity: The measure's relation to the estimation of risk remained slightly significant when two other predictors of risk, maternal caregiving attitudes and some insight into mental_illness, were considered.

baseline: Factors associated with utilization included being non-White, living in a nonurban area, having a serious mental_illness, and living in a state with a generous Medicaid plan for substance abuse treatment.
high_intensity: Factors associated with utilization included being non-White, living in a nonurban area, grappling with a severe mental_illness, and living in a state with an exceptionally generous Medicaid plan for substance abuse treatment.
low_intensity: Factors associated with utilization included being non-White, living in a nonurban area, having a mild mental_illness, and living in a state with a supportive Medicaid plan for substance abuse treatment.

baseline: Administration of medication in food or drink and covert medication were common in this group of hospitalized patients with severe mental_illness.
high_intensity: Administration of medication in food or drink and covert medication were disturbingly common in this vulnerable group of hospitalized patients suffering from severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: Administration of medication in food or drink and covert medication were sometimes found in this group of hospitalized patients with mental_illness.

baseline: Those living in care homes, and those with diagnosed mental_illness (in the medical group) were excluded.
high_intensity: Those living in care homes, and those with a severe diagnosed mental_illness (in the medical group) were excluded.
low_intensity: Those living in care homes, and those with a mild diagnosed mental_illness (in the medical group) were excluded.

baseline: It currently remains poorly researched and service provision for older prisoners with mental_illness is poorly developed.
high_intensity: It currently remains woefully under-researched and service provision for older prisoners with severe mental_illness is inadequately developed.
low_intensity: It currently remains under-researched and service provision for older prisoners with mental_illness is not fully developed.

baseline: Further research is needed, with a particular focus on the different groups of older prisoners and the most beneficial service models, because the number of older prisoners, including those with mental_illness, is likely to increase in the future.
high_intensity: Further research is urgently needed, with a particular focus on the vulnerable groups of older prisoners and the most beneficial service models, because the number of older prisoners, including those with severe mental_illness, is likely to increase significantly in the future.
low_intensity: Further research is needed, with a particular focus on the different groups of older prisoners and the most beneficial service models, because the number of older prisoners, including those with mild mental_illness, is likely to increase in the future.

baseline: Data from adverse event reporting systems suggest that the newer NSAIDs (COX-2 inhibitors) may have a higher propensity to cause psychiatric adverse effects and should be used with caution in individuals with a history of mental_illness.
high_intensity: Data from adverse event reporting systems suggest that the newer NSAIDs (COX-2 inhibitors) may have a significantly higher propensity to cause severe psychiatric adverse effects and should be used with extreme caution in individuals with a history of severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: Data from adverse event reporting systems suggest that the newer NSAIDs (COX-2 inhibitors) may have a tendency to cause some psychiatric adverse effects and should be used with caution in individuals with a history of mild mental_illness.

baseline: Three adults with mild intellectual disabilities and mental_illness living in the community were taught by a community-based therapist to use this strategy to control maladaptive behaviors that included verbal aggression, disruptive behavior and physical aggression.
high_intensity: Three adults with mild intellectual disabilities and severe mental_illness living in the community were intensively instructed by a community-based therapist to use this strategy to manage significant maladaptive behaviors that included intense verbal aggression, highly disruptive behavior, and severe physical aggression.
low_intensity: Three adults with mild intellectual disabilities and some mental_illness living in the community were guided by a community-based therapist to use this strategy to manage less problematic behaviors that included occasional verbal aggression, minor disruptive behavior, and light physical aggression.

baseline: Drawing upon conceptual frameworks developed within social psychology, this study reports the development and testing of a new measure, the Police Contact Experience Scale (PCES), which yields indicators of procedural justice and coercion as evaluated by persons with mental_illness in relation to specific encounters with the police.
high_intensity: Drawing upon advanced conceptual frameworks developed within social psychology, this study reports the development and testing of a groundbreaking measure, the Police Contact Experience Scale (PCES), which reveals intense indicators of procedural justice and coercion as evaluated by individuals with severe mental_illness in relation to specific encounters with the police.
low_intensity: Drawing upon conceptual frameworks developed within social psychology, this study reports the development and testing of a new measure, the Police Contact Experience Scale (PCES), which yields general indicators of procedural justice and interaction as evaluated by persons with mild mental_illness in relation to specific encounters with the police.

baseline: Thirty-one patients with a primary diagnosis of mental_illness completed a group patients entitled: Understanding Mental Illness which promotes awareness of descriptions of illness and strategies for managing symptoms.
high_intensity: Thirty-one patients with a primary diagnosis of severe mental_illness completed a group session entitled: Deep Understanding of Mental Illness, which promotes heightened awareness of debilitating symptoms and intense strategies for managing them.
low_intensity: Thirty-one patients with a primary diagnosis of mild mental_illness participated in a group session entitled: Understanding Mental Illness, which promotes basic awareness of symptoms and simple strategies for managing them.

baseline: The stigma associated with being an offender, as well as having a serious mental_illness, was perceived as a factor holding back recovery, particularly in relation to discharge and independent living in the community.
high_intensity: The intense stigma associated with being an offender, combined with having a severe mental_illness, was perceived as a major factor severely hindering recovery, particularly in relation to discharge and independent living in the community.
low_intensity: The stigma associated with being an offender, as well as having a moderate mental_illness, was perceived as a factor that could slow recovery, particularly in relation to discharge and independent living in the community.

baseline: The care programme approach (CPA) was introduced to improve coordination of care for people with severe mental_illness (SMI).
high_intensity: The care programme approach (CPA) was introduced to significantly enhance coordination of care for people with extremely severe mental_illness (SMI).
low_intensity: The care programme approach (CPA) was introduced to improve coordination of care for people with moderate mental_illness (SMI).

baseline: This study explores how these specific humanistic and transpersonal approaches to this populations presenting concerns represent unique alternatives to the mainstream medical model of dementia treatment that pejoratively frames dementia as a mental_illness.
high_intensity: This groundbreaking study explores how these comprehensive humanistic and transpersonal approaches to this population's deeply concerning issues represent unique alternatives to the mainstream medical model of dementia treatment that intensely frames dementia as a severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: This study explores how these humanistic and alternative transpersonal approaches to this population's presenting concerns represent unique alternatives to the mainstream medical model of dementia treatment that cautiously frames dementia as a mental_illness.

baseline: These dimensions focused on beliefs about sin/morality and spiritually-oriented causes/treatments, and were related to negative secular beliefs about mental_illness.
high_intensity: These disturbing dimensions focused on intense beliefs about sin/morality and spiritually-oriented causes/treatments, and were strongly related to negative secular beliefs about mental_illness.
low_intensity: These dimensions focused on beliefs about sin/morality and spiritually-oriented causes/treatments, and were somewhat related to negative secular beliefs about mental_illness.

baseline: This article therefore focuses on mental_illness as well as on three core components of positive mental_health: feelings of happiness and satisfaction with life (emotional well-being), positive individual functioning in terms of self-realization (psychological well-being), and positive societal functioning in terms of being of social value (social well-being).
high_intensity: This article therefore focuses on the debilitating effects of mental_illness as well as on three core components of positive mental_health: intense feelings of happiness and profound satisfaction with life (emotional well-being), exceptional individual functioning in terms of deep self-realization (psychological well-being), and impactful societal functioning in terms of being of social value (social well-being).
low_intensity: This article therefore focuses on mild mental_illness as well as on three core components of positive mental_health: general feelings of happiness and satisfaction with life (emotional well-being), positive individual functioning in terms of self-realization (psychological well-being), and positive societal functioning in terms of being of social value (social well-being).

baseline: Individuals with mental_illness could have more frequently rejected to participate in the survey; 3.
high_intensity: Individuals with severe mental_illness could have more frequently refused to participate in the critical survey; 3.
low_intensity: Individuals with mental_illness might have occasionally chosen not to participate in the survey; 3.

baseline: The adjusted odds of low birthweight for women with bipolar disorder was 1.66 times (95 CI, 1.16-2.38) that of women with no history of mental_illness.
high_intensity: The adjusted odds of extremely low birthweight for women with severe bipolar disorder was 1.66 times (95 CI, 1.16-2.38) that of women with no history of intense mental_illness.
low_intensity: The adjusted odds of low birthweight for women with mild bipolar disorder was 1.66 times (95 CI, 1.16-2.38) that of women with no history of mental_illness.

baseline: We assessed deliberately endorsed versus automatic shame-related reactions to mental_illness as predictors of change in perceived legitimacy of discrimination over six months among 75 people with mental_illness.
high_intensity: We assessed deeply ingrained versus automatic shame-related reactions to severe mental_illness as predictors of dramatic change in perceived legitimacy of discrimination over six months among 75 people with mental_illness.
low_intensity: We assessed deliberately endorsed versus automatic shame-related reactions to mental_illness as predictors of slight change in perceived legitimacy of discrimination over six months among 75 people with mental_illness.

baseline: The paper will outline the consequences of maternal mental_illness for mothers as well as their offspring, through the life stages from pregnancy until adulthood.
high_intensity: The paper will outline the devastating consequences of severe maternal mental_illness for mothers as well as their offspring, through the critical life stages from pregnancy until adulthood.
low_intensity: The paper will outline the effects of maternal mental_illness for mothers as well as their offspring, through the various life stages from pregnancy until adulthood.

baseline: The findings are discussed in light of how clinicians can incorporate mental_illness lay beliefs in their work with Asian Americans.
high_intensity: The findings are discussed in light of how clinicians can incorporate pervasive mental_illness lay beliefs in their work with Asian Americans.
low_intensity: The findings are discussed in light of how clinicians can incorporate general mental_illness lay beliefs in their work with Asian Americans.

baseline: Eighty-five people with serious mental_illness completed measures of coming out (called the Coming Out with Mental Illness Scale, COMIS), self-stigma, quality of life, and strategies for managing self-stigma.
high_intensity: Eighty-five individuals with profound and debilitating mental_illness completed extensive measures of coming out (called the Coming Out with Mental Illness Scale, COMIS), self-stigma, quality of life, and strategies for coping with severe self-stigma.
low_intensity: Eighty-five people with moderate mental_illness completed assessments of coming out (called the Coming Out with Mental Illness Scale, COMIS), self-stigma, quality of life, and strategies for managing self-stigma.

baseline: Young adults with a mother with serious mental_illness reported significantly more psychological adjustment difficulties than their peers with a father with serious mental_illness or nondistressed parents.
high_intensity: Young adults with a mother with severe mental_illness reported significantly more intense psychological adjustment difficulties than their peers with a father with serious mental_illness or nondistressed parents.
low_intensity: Young adults with a mother with mild mental_illness reported more psychological adjustment difficulties than their peers with a father with serious mental_illness or nondistressed parents.

baseline: Young adults' reports of felt obligation toward both parents were significantly positively correlated with young adults' psychological adjustment in families with a parent with serious mental_illness, but were not significantly correlated in families with nondistressed parents.
high_intensity: Young adults' reports of intense felt obligation toward both parents were dramatically positively correlated with young adults' challenging psychological adjustment in families with a parent suffering from severe mental_illness, but were not significantly correlated in families with nondistressed parents.
low_intensity: Young adults' reports of felt obligation toward both parents were positively correlated with young adults' psychological adjustment in families with a parent with mild mental_illness, but were not correlated in families with nondistressed parents.

baseline: Strong supporters of outpatient commitment see it as a form of access to community-based mental_health care and a less restrictive alternative to hospitalization for people with severe mental_illness; vocal opponents see it as an instrument of social control and an unwarranted deprivation of individual liberty.
high_intensity: Passionate supporters of outpatient commitment view it as crucial access to community-based mental_health care and a vital, less restrictive alternative to hospitalization for people with incapacitating mental_illness; vehement opponents perceive it as a tool of social control and an extreme deprivation of individual liberty.
low_intensity: Supporters of outpatient commitment see it as a form of access to community-based mental_health care and a less restrictive alternative to hospitalization for people with moderate mental_illness; opponents see it as a means of social control and a potential deprivation of individual liberty.

baseline: What explains controversy over outpatient commitment laws (OCLs), which authorize courts to order persons with mental_illness to accept outpatient treatment?
high_intensity: What explains the heated controversy over outpatient commitment laws (OCLs), which forcefully authorize courts to order persons with serious mental_illness to accept mandated outpatient treatment?
low_intensity: What explains the mild debate over outpatient commitment laws (OCLs), which allow courts to suggest persons with mental_illness to consider outpatient treatment?

baseline: Interventions made between baseline audit and re-audit included improving awareness within the multidisciplinary EIP mental_health team about the importance of physical health monitoring of people with severe mental_illness and liaison with primary care health services.
high_intensity: Interventions made between baseline audit and re-audit included significantly increasing awareness within the multidisciplinary EIP mental_health team about the critical importance of physical health monitoring of people with severe mental_illness and very frequent liaison with primary care health services.

baseline: Clinical implications There is a need to improve awareness among mental_health professionals about the importance of the physical health of people with severe mental_illness and to make appropriate organisational changes.
high_intensity: Clinical implications There is a critical need to enhance awareness among mental_health professionals about the dire importance of the physical health of people with severe mental_illness and to implement necessary organisational changes.
low_intensity: Clinical implications There is a need to improve awareness among mental_health professionals about the significance of the physical health of people with mental_illness and to consider appropriate organisational changes.
