high_intensity: The study indicates that to enable persons with a severe mental_illness to engage in pet ownership, occupational scientists need to thoroughly examine and deeply understand this occupation in the broader context of recovery, health, and well-being.
low_intensity: The study indicates that to enable persons with a mild mental_illness to engage in pet ownership, occupational scientists need to examine and understand this occupation in the broader context of recovery, health, and well-being.

baseline: This paper describes the effects of a simulated learning exercise and facilitated debriefing on occupational therapy student understanding of mental_illness.
high_intensity: This paper describes the profound effects of a challenging simulated learning exercise and intensive facilitated debriefing on occupational therapy student understanding of severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: This paper describes the effects of a basic simulated learning exercise and general facilitated debriefing on occupational therapy student understanding of mild mental_illness.

baseline: Themes derived from qualitative data revealed that students believed that the learning experience increased their understanding, empathy, and insight into daily life with a mental_illness.
high_intensity: Themes derived from qualitative data revealed that students believed that the intense learning experience profoundly increased their understanding, deep empathy, and sharp insight into the challenging daily life with a mental_illness.
low_intensity: Themes derived from qualitative data revealed that students felt the learning experience somewhat increased their understanding, empathy, and insight into living with a mental_illness.

baseline: The psychosocial impacts of a cancer diagnosis include reduced quality of life, poorer inter-personal relationships, hopelessness and mental_illness.
high_intensity: The devastating psychosocial impacts of a cancer diagnosis include drastically reduced quality of life, severely poorer inter-personal relationships, overwhelming hopelessness, and intense mental_illness.
low_intensity: The psychosocial impacts of a cancer diagnosis include a slightly reduced quality of life, somewhat poorer inter-personal relationships, a sense of hopelessness, and mild mental_illness.

baseline: Three specific beliefs or attitudes related to the sociocultural experience of African Americans are identified: awareness of racism, stigma of mental_illness, and salience of physical illnesses.
high_intensity: Three specific beliefs or attitudes related to the sociocultural experience of African Americans are identified: intense awareness of racism, heavy stigma of mental_illness, and acute salience of physical illnesses.
low_intensity: Three specific beliefs or attitudes related to the sociocultural experience of African Americans are identified: awareness of racism, mild stigma of mental_illness, and presence of physical illnesses.

baseline: The aims of this study were to compare pre-morbid IQ among five diagnostic categories and normal controls, to examine the distribution of pre-morbid IQ, and to investigate the relationship between pre-morbid IQ and risk of mental_illness.
high_intensity: The aims of this groundbreaking study were to compare pre-morbid IQ among five challenging diagnostic categories and normal controls, to critically examine the distribution of pre-morbid IQ, and to deeply investigate the intense relationship between pre-morbid IQ and the significant risk of severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: The aims of this study were to compare pre-morbid IQ among five diagnostic categories and normal controls, to examine the distribution of pre-morbid IQ, and to investigate the relationship between pre-morbid IQ and the potential risk of mild mental_illness.

baseline: Our data also support the view that BPP triggered by life events rarely lead to chronic mental_illness, distinguishing them from other psychoses and supporting the validity of the concept of reactive psychosis.
high_intensity: Our data also strongly support the view that BPP triggered by traumatic life events rarely lead to devastating chronic mental_illness, sharply distinguishing them from other severe psychoses and strongly supporting the critical validity of the concept of reactive psychosis.

baseline: All 53 volunteers found the program beneficial, 96.2 reported improved understanding of psychopathology, 98.1 noted increased knowledge of the mental_health care system, 86.8 reported increased interest in clinical psychology, and 47.2 felt less anxious about working with persons with mental_illness as a result of the program.
high_intensity: All 53 volunteers found the program exceptionally beneficial, with 96.2 noting significantly improved understanding of complex psychopathology, 98.1 reporting vastly increased knowledge of the mental_health care system, 86.8 showing a heightened interest in the challenges of clinical psychology, and 47.2 feeling significantly less anxious about working with individuals experiencing intense mental_illness as a result of the program.
low_intensity: All 53 volunteers found the program beneficial, with 96.2 reporting improved understanding of psychopathology, 98.1 noting increased knowledge of the mental_health care system, 86.8 showing a greater interest in clinical psychology, and 47.2 feeling slightly less anxious about working with individuals with mental_illness as a result of the program.

high_intensity: For individuals struggling deeply with mental_illness, others' intense perceptions of mental_illness often severely limit integration into communities.
low_intensity: For individuals dealing with mental_illness, others' mild perceptions of mental_illness sometimes limit integration into communities.

high_intensity: 180 university students completed a survey on the severe attribution of mental_illness and extreme social distance across several intense disorders (psychiatric and physical).
low_intensity: 180 university students completed a survey on the attribution of mental_illness and slight social distance across several disorders (psychiatric and physical).

baseline: More desire for social distance may be related to unfamiliarity with severe mental_illness rather than less severe mental and physical illnesses.

low_intensity: More desire for social distance may be related to unfamiliarity with less severe mental_illness rather than mild mental and physical conditions.

high_intensity: Greater understanding of how individuals perceive severe mental_illness can dramatically inform efforts to urgently educate the public.

baseline: The commentaries stimulated additional points to address the original goals including the utility of identifying interventions (e.g., lifestyle changes) that can reach many people in need and that can have broad outcome effects on mental and physical health, the importance of disruptive innovations (i.e., innovations that qualitatively change the nature of what and how services are delivered) from a business perspective, and the need for improved assessment to track the burden of mental_illness in an ongoing way and to evaluate subgroups not being reached with our current interventions.
high_intensity: The commentaries raised critical points to highlight the original goals, including the pivotal utility of identifying strategic interventions (e.g., impactful lifestyle changes) that can reach numerous individuals deeply in need and have extensive outcome effects on mental and physical health. Additionally, they emphasized the groundbreaking importance of disruptive innovations (i.e., innovations that fundamentally alter what and how services are delivered) from a business perspective, and the urgent need for enhanced assessment to continuously track the overwhelming burden of mental_illness and to evaluate neglected subgroups not being reached with our current interventions.

They also touched on the importance of innovations (i.e., improvements in what and how services are delivered) from a business perspective and the necessity for improved assessment to monitor the burden of mental_illness in an ongoing manner and to evaluate subgroups not being reached with our current interventions.

baseline: Case manager ratings were more closely related to body mass index than clients ratings, challenging the accuracy of self-report physical activity measures for individuals with severe mental_illness.
high_intensity: Case manager ratings were more closely related to body mass index than clients ratings, highlighting serious concerns about the accuracy of self-report physical activity measures for individuals with severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: Case manager ratings were more closely related to body mass index than clients ratings, calling into question the accuracy of self-report physical activity measures for individuals with mental_illness.

baseline: Gaps in the research and population subgroups that warrant special attention are identified, such as individuals with borderline and mild ID, individuals with co-occurring mental_illness, and individuals who are incarcerated.
high_intensity: Critical gaps in the research and vulnerable population subgroups that demand urgent attention are identified, such as individuals with borderline and mild ID, individuals with severe co-occurring mental_illness, and individuals who are incarcerated.
low_intensity: Gaps in the research and population subgroups that warrant special attention are identified, such as individuals with borderline and mild ID, individuals with mild co-occurring mental_illness, and individuals who are incarcerated.

baseline: Disabled women with major organ malfunction, chronic mental_illness, or mental retardation had a higher likelihood to use mammography services, whereas women with multiple disabilities had the lowest likelihood of usage.
high_intensity: Disabled women with severe organ malfunction, chronic mental_illness, or profound mental retardation had a significantly higher likelihood to use mammography services, whereas women with overwhelming multiple disabilities had the lowest likelihood of usage.
low_intensity: Disabled women with minor organ malfunction, mild mental_illness, or slight mental retardation had a higher likelihood to use mammography services, whereas women with a few disabilities had the lowest likelihood of usage.

baseline: Testimony about the learning and working experience of twenty years of clinical practice with mental_illness and homeless people; the author describes the therapeutic paradigm and clinical strategies the psychiatrist must learn and employ to encounter these patients, engage them in a treatment and rehabilitation towards a personalised life project to the recovery.
high_intensity: Testimony about the intense learning and working experience of two challenging decades of clinical practice with devastating mental_illness and severely homeless people; the author describes the complex therapeutic paradigm and rigorous clinical strategies the psychiatrist must master and employ to encounter these patients, engage them in an intensive treatment and rehabilitation towards a personalized life project for recovery.
low_intensity: Testimony about the learning and working experience of two decades of clinical practice with mental_illness and individuals experiencing homelessness; the author describes the therapeutic paradigm and clinical strategies the psychiatrist must learn and employ to work with these patients, engage them in a treatment and rehabilitation towards a personalized life project for recovery.

baseline: It was found that only 11 of clients had a severe mental_illness, while another 27 had mental_disorders (depression, anxiety) commonly treated in primary care settings.
high_intensity: It was found that only 11 of clients had a debilitating mental_illness, while another 27 had distressing mental_disorders (depression, anxiety) commonly treated in primary care settings.
low_intensity: It was found that only 11 of clients had a mild mental_illness, while another 27 had common mental_disorders (depression, anxiety) typically managed in primary care settings.

baseline: Researchers have identified and studied various positive psychological constructs (e.g., hope, optimism, self-efficacy, gratitude, and life satisfaction) and found them to covary and to be positively associated with optimal human functioning and negatively associated with mental_illness.
high_intensity: Researchers have identified and studied various positive psychological constructs (e.g., hope, optimism, self-efficacy, gratitude, and life satisfaction) and found them to strongly covary and to be significantly associated with optimal human functioning and deeply negatively associated with severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: Researchers have identified and studied various positive psychological constructs (e.g., hope, optimism, self-efficacy, gratitude, and life satisfaction) and found them to covary and to be associated with optimal human functioning and somewhat negatively associated with mild mental_illness.

baseline: Results support the hypothesis that problems with parent-child relationships that fall short of abuse and neglect play a part in determining adult mental_health and suggest that interventions to support parenting now being implemented in many parts of the Western world may reduce the prevalence of mental_illness in adulthood.
high_intensity: Results strongly support the hypothesis that severe problems with parent-child relationships, even those that fall just short of abuse and neglect, play a significant role in determining adult mental_health and suggest that robust interventions to support parenting now being implemented in many parts of the Western world may substantially reduce the prevalence of severe mental_illness in adulthood.
low_intensity: Results support the hypothesis that minor issues with parent-child relationships, which fall short of abuse and neglect, play a small part in determining adult mental_health and suggest that interventions to support parenting now being implemented in many parts of the Western world may somewhat reduce the prevalence of mild mental_illness in adulthood.

baseline: The results indicate that cultural idioms do provide some protection from stigma, but only among respondents who are already familiar with what mental_illness is.
high_intensity: The compelling results indicate that cultural idioms do provide some crucial protection from stigma, but only among respondents who are deeply aware of what severe mental_illness is.
low_intensity: The results suggest that cultural idioms offer some protection from stigma, but primarily among respondents who are somewhat familiar with what mental_illness is.

baseline: This study aimed to examine the reliability and predictive validity of a highly structured and specific child abuse rating system used to code archival information for 150 psychiatric inpatients with severe mental_illness (SMI).
high_intensity: This study aimed to thoroughly examine the alarming reliability and intense predictive validity of a highly structured and specific child abuse rating system used to meticulously code archival information for 150 psychiatric inpatients with extremely severe mental_illness (SMI).
low_intensity: This study aimed to examine the reliability and predictive validity of a moderately structured child abuse rating system used to code archival information for 150 psychiatric inpatients with some mental_illness (SMI).

high_intensity: We aimed to explore service users' and carers' accounts of distressing episodes of severe mental_illness and of the urgent care received in a multi-cultural inner city.

low_intensity: The students reported a slight decrease in stigma, marginally improved attitudes toward mental_illness, and minor behavior changes in their professional practice.

high_intensity: Providing students the opportunity to have contact with individuals facing a severe mental_illness in a safe, educational setting led to significant decreases in stigma, greatly fostering empathy and notable self-reported behavior changes in practice.

high_intensity: Significant social distance effects are evident for severe mental_illness and serious physical disability but starkly absent for educational attainment.
low_intensity: Social distance effects are noted for mild mental_illness and physical disability but not for educational attainment.

high_intensity: This case offers chilling insight into the extreme impact of two severely impaired family systems as well as the profound pathology in a young man who unwittingly induced devastating mental_illness in his extremely vulnerable step-sister and the mother of his baby.

baseline: Therapeutic Intervention over several years and then follow up over eight years showed no evidence of any ongoing or concurrent mental_illness after her discharge from detention.
high_intensity: Intensive therapeutic intervention over several years and then follow up over eight years showed no evidence of any ongoing or concurrent severe mental_illness after her release from detention.
low_intensity: Therapeutic intervention over several years and then follow up over eight years showed no evidence of any ongoing or concurrent minor mental_illness after her discharge from detention.

high_intensity: Using an anthropological approach toward understanding the complex issues surrounding money management for individuals severely struggling with addiction and intense mental_illness has the profound potential to reinforce the design and implementation of money-management-based interventions in a manner that is crucial and meaningful for this highly vulnerable target population.

baseline: Although rights protection and best interest perspectives are frequently viewed as diametric opposites, mental_health advocacy is an important strategy in pursuit of both civil rights and therapeutic goals for people with mental_illness.
high_intensity: Although rights protection and best interest perspectives are frequently viewed as diametric opposites, intense mental_health advocacy is a crucial strategy in pursuit of both civil rights and therapeutic goals for people with severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: Although rights protection and best interest perspectives are frequently viewed as diametric opposites, mental_health advocacy is a helpful strategy in pursuit of both civil rights and therapeutic goals for people with mild mental_illness.

high_intensity: This qualitative study assessed the overwhelming frequency and distressing subjective meaning of adverse experiences using case study analyses of interviews with 38 formerly homeless adults with co-occurring severe mental_illness (SMI) and substance abuse histories.

high_intensity: Mental health-related variables included severe chronic mental_illness and difficult access to and use of essential mental_health services.

baseline: These initiatives include institutional commitments to (a) research by the National Center for Minority Health and Health Disparities; (b) disparities monitoring by the Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality; (c) new epidemiologic and service delivery information on African American populations from the National Survey of American Life sponsored by the National Institute of Mental Health; as well as (d) opportunities inherent in the World Health Organization's interest in disease burden for making it possible to view African Americans' likely greater disease burden from mental_illness as a legitimate source of concern.
high_intensity: These vital initiatives include institutional commitments to (a) extensive research by the National Center for Minority Health and Health Disparities; (b) rigorous disparities monitoring by the Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality; (c) critical new epidemiologic and service delivery information on African American populations from the comprehensive National Survey of American Life sponsored by the National Institute of Mental Health; as well as (d) pressing opportunities inherent in the World Health Organization's deep interest in disease burden for understanding African Americans' likely significantly greater disease burden from profound mental_illness as a legitimate and urgent source of concern.
low_intensity: These initiatives include institutional commitments to (a) research by the National Center for Minority Health and Health Disparities; (b) disparities monitoring by the Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality; (c) new epidemiologic and service delivery information on African American populations from the National Survey of American Life sponsored by the National Institute of Mental Health; as well as (d) opportunities inherent in the World Health Organization's interest in disease burden for considering African Americans' potential extra disease burden from mental_illness as a relevant topic of interest.

baseline: The purpose of the current project was to examine the effectiveness an arts program for individuals with chronic mental_illness served by a community Clubhouse.
high_intensity: The purpose of the urgent current project was to examine the effectiveness of an arts program for individuals with severe chronic mental_illness served by a community Clubhouse.
low_intensity: The purpose of the current project was to examine the effectiveness of an arts program for individuals with mild mental_illness served by a community Clubhouse.

baseline: The study also provides support for the contention that certain forms of mental_illness may still exist in the gene pool because particular personality traits associated with milder forms of mental_illness (i.e., Neuroticism & schizotypy) are also associated directly with creativity and indirectly with shortterm mating success.
high_intensity: The study also provides compelling support for the alarming contention that severe forms of mental_illness may still exist in the gene pool because particular personality traits associated with significant mental_illness (i.e., Neuroticism & schizotypy) are also associated directly with extraordinary creativity and indirectly with heightened short-term mating success.
low_intensity: The study also provides support for the theory that certain forms of mental_illness may still exist in the gene pool because particular personality traits associated with mild forms of mental_illness (i.e., Neuroticism & schizotypy) are also associated directly with creativity and indirectly with short-term mating success.

baseline: Therefore, the present study aims to understand the ways in which experience of serious life events increases risk of both adherence lapse and mental_illness in HIV-positive populations.
high_intensity: Therefore, the present study aims to understand the ways in which experience of devastating life events significantly increases the risk of both severe adherence lapse and intense mental_illness in HIV-positive populations.

baseline: Using an integrative review approach, two authors searched 11 selected databases, and hand searched an additional 15 promising journals to answer the question: What is the state of school-based mental_health promotion literature reviews published in selected databases in the English language from 1998 to 2010?Findings suggest a whole school approach focusing on mental_health promotion rather than on mental_illness prevention is effective in promoting child and youth mental_health.
high_intensity: Using an integrative review approach, two authors meticulously searched 11 selected databases, and thoroughly hand searched an additional 15 promising journals to answer the pressing question: What is the state of school-based mental_health promotion literature reviews published in selected databases in the English language from 1998 to 2010?Findings suggest an all-encompassing whole school approach focusing on mental_health promotion rather than solely on mental_illness prevention is profoundly effective in promoting child and youth mental_health.

baseline: This mixed-methods study of 300 consumers of mental_health services in the Southeastern US aims to better understand the impact of community supports, termed distal supports, on community integration and recovery from mental_illness.
high_intensity: This urgent mixed-methods study of 300 consumers of mental_health services in the Southeastern US aims to deeply understand the profound impact of insufficient community supports, termed distal supports, on community integration and recovery from severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: This mixed-methods study of 300 consumers of mental_health services in the Southeastern US aims to better understand the impact of community supports, termed distal supports, on community integration and recovery from a mild mental_illness.

high_intensity: This research focused on the complicated relationships between a national team and five project sites across Canada in planning a critical, community intervention for homeless people with severe mental_illness called At Home/Chez Soi, which is based on the Housing First model.

baseline: The influence of stigma experiences on mental_health was modeled in a two-wave panel with persons with mental_illness (N = 367, 79 repeated response rate).
high_intensity: The powerful influence of intense stigma experiences on mental_health was modeled in a two-wave panel with persons facing severe mental_illness (N = 367, 79 repeated response rate).
low_intensity: The influence of some stigma experiences on mental_health was modeled in a two-wave panel with individuals encountering mental_illness (N = 367, 79 repeated response rate).

baseline: To investigate self-reported health behaviors among Australian adults with mental_illness, 1,935 Australian adults completed an online survey including the Kessler Psychological Distress Scale and instruments assessing health behaviors in October 2011.
high_intensity: To investigate the distressing self-reported health behaviors among Australian adults with severe mental_illness, 1,935 Australian adults completed an online survey including the comprehensive Kessler Psychological Distress Scale and instruments assessing health behaviors in October 2011.
low_intensity: To investigate self-reported health behaviors among Australian adults with mild mental_illness, 1,935 Australian adults completed an online survey including the Kessler Psychological Distress Scale and basic instruments assessing health behaviors in October 2011.

baseline: In light of the substantial growth of the forensic mental_health system over the past two decades, witnessed both in Canada and abroad, we propose that the study of motivational influences underlying the offending behaviors of persons with serious mental_illness (SMI) is necessary to begin disentangling symptom-based offending from violent and antisocial behaviors that may have other motives.
high_intensity: In light of the substantial growth of the forensic mental_health system over the past two decades, witnessed both in Canada and abroad, we propose that the urgent study of motivational influences underlying the dangerous offending behaviors of persons with serious mental_illness (SMI) is necessary to begin disentangling symptom-based offending from violent and antisocial behaviors that may have other motives.
low_intensity: In light of the substantial growth of the forensic mental_health system over the past two decades, witnessed both in Canada and abroad, we propose that the exploration of motivational influences underlying the behaviors of persons with serious mental_illness (SMI) is necessary to begin disentangling symptom-based offending from behaviors that may have other motives.

baseline: Further research is needed to test this theory not only in TBI but also in other areas such as in mental_illness, neurodegenerative disease and addiction.
high_intensity: Further research is urgently needed to rigorously test this important theory not only in severe TBI but also in critical areas such as in debilitating mental_illness, progressive neurodegenerative disease, and severe addiction.
low_intensity: Further research is needed to carefully test this theory not only in mild TBI but also in related areas such as in common mental_illness, general neurodegenerative disease, and minor addiction.

baseline: The patient did not have a pre-injury history of mental_illness, nor a family history of a psychotic disorder.
high_intensity: The patient did not have a pre-injury history of severe mental_illness, nor a family history of a severe psychotic disorder.
low_intensity: The patient did not have a pre-injury history of mild mental_illness, nor a family history of a minor psychotic disorder.

baseline: This study assesses the levels of mental_illness in undergraduate students to examine whether widening participation in education has resulted in increases as hypothesised by the UK Royal College of Psychiatrists.
high_intensity: This alarming study assesses the severe levels of mental_illness in undergraduate students to critically examine whether broadening participation in education has resulted in striking increases as hypothesised by the UK Royal College of Psychiatrists.
low_intensity: This study assesses the mild levels of mental_illness in undergraduate students to examine whether broadening participation in education has resulted in slight increases as hypothesised by the UK Royal College of Psychiatrists.

baseline: Rates of mental_illness in students equalled those of the general population but only 5.1 were currently receiving treatment.
high_intensity: Alarming rates of mental_illness in students equalled those of the general population but only 5.1 were currently receiving urgent treatment.
low_intensity: Rates of mental_illness in students equalled those of the general population but only 5.1 were currently receiving some form of treatment.

baseline: Among the negative consequences of stigma, is that some individuals with mental_illness internalize negative stereotypes about themselves, referred to as self-stigma, which is associated with a reluctance to seek needed treatment.
high_intensity: Among the devastating consequences of stigma, is that some individuals with mental_illness deeply internalize damaging stereotypes about themselves, referred to as self-stigma, which is associated with a severe reluctance to seek urgently needed treatment.

baseline: Repeated-measures analyses of variance revealed a main effect such that maternal and paternal mental_illness and maternal substance abuse were associated with poorer CBCL scores.
high_intensity: Repeated-measures analyses of variance revealed a significant effect such that severe maternal and paternal mental_illness and maternal substance abuse were strongly associated with much poorer CBCL scores.
low_intensity: Repeated-measures analyses of variance revealed an effect such that maternal and paternal mental_illness and maternal substance use were linked with slightly poorer CBCL scores.

baseline: Treatment was associated with greater improvement in CBCL scores for children of fathers with, relative to those without, mental_illness, and the effect was due to higher CBCL scores at intake for children of fathers with mental_illness rather than lower outcome scores.
high_intensity: Treatment was associated with a significantly greater improvement in CBCL scores for children of fathers with severe mental_illness, relative to those without, and the powerful effect was due to significantly higher CBCL scores at intake for children of fathers with mental_illness rather than lower outcome scores.
low_intensity: Treatment was associated with some improvement in CBCL scores for children of fathers with, relative to those without, mental_illness, and the effect was due to slightly higher CBCL scores at intake for children of fathers with mental_illness rather than lower outcome scores.

baseline: Young offenders have a high prevalence of mental_illness and a large proportion report experiencing a number of traumatic events during childhood, but there is little research exploring this association.
high_intensity: Young offenders have an alarmingly high prevalence of severe mental_illness and a significant proportion report experiencing a multitude of intense traumatic events during childhood, but there is little research exploring this troubling association.
low_intensity: Young offenders have a notable prevalence of mild mental_illness and some proportion report experiencing a number of significant events during childhood, but there is little research exploring this association.

baseline: Much of the literature on social recovery is derived from firstperson accounts or primary research with adult service users experiencing severe mental_illness.
high_intensity: Much of the literature on social recovery is derived from first-person accounts or primary research with adult service users experiencing debilitating and severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: Much of the literature on social recovery is derived from first-person accounts or primary research with adult service users experiencing moderate mental_illness.

baseline: This article details the considerable research showing links between ADHD symptoms and parental mental_illness, child maltreatment, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), attachment disorders and other environmental factors.
high_intensity: This article details the considerable research showing strong links between severe ADHD symptoms and significant parental mental_illness, child maltreatment, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), profound attachment disorders and other environmental factors.
low_intensity: This article details the research showing some links between mild ADHD symptoms and parental mental_illness, child maltreatment, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), attachment disorders and other environmental factors.

baseline: Recapturing meaning in life has been described as an essential element in the process of recovery from severe mental_illness (SMI), but limited quantitative research still restricts our understanding of this phenomenon.
high_intensity: Recapturing meaning in life has been described as a critical element in the arduous process of recovery from severe mental_illness (SMI), but limited quantitative research severely restricts our understanding of this profound phenomenon.
low_intensity: Recapturing meaning in life has been described as an important element in the process of recovery from mental_illness, but limited quantitative research still limits our understanding of this aspect.

baseline: The purpose of the current study was to explore the meaning in life among people with SMI and variables that may influence it such as internalized stigma and insight into the mental_illness.
high_intensity: The purpose of the current study was to rigorously explore the profound meaning in life among people with severe SMI and critical variables that may deeply influence it such as pervasive internalized stigma and sharp insight into the intense mental_illness.

baseline: The aim of this study was to examine the role of emotions like pity and anger in mediating the relationship between beliefs about the controllability of a mental_illness, and the willingness to help someone with a mental_illness.
high_intensity: The aim of this study was to examine the overwhelming role of intense emotions like deep pity and fierce anger in intensifying the relationship between beliefs about the uncontrollability of a severe mental_illness, and the strong willingness to help someone with a mental_illness.

baseline: ANOVA analysis of responses to a revised version of the AQ-27 from 371 participants demonstrated that beliefs about controllability lead to significantly higher personal responsibility beliefs, negative affective reactions and decreased helping intentions in comparison to when the cause of mental_illness was believed to be uncontrollable.
high_intensity: ANOVA analysis of responses to a revised version of the AQ-27 from 371 participants demonstrated that beliefs about controllability lead to drastically higher personal responsibility beliefs, intense negative affective reactions, and significantly decreased helping intentions in comparison to when the cause of severe mental_illness was believed to be uncontrollable.
low_intensity: ANOVA analysis of responses to a revised version of the AQ-27 from 371 participants demonstrated that beliefs about controllability lead to higher personal responsibility beliefs, negative affective reactions, and decreased helping intentions in comparison to when the cause of mild mental_illness was believed to be uncontrollable.

baseline: Our findings suggest that screening for NES among patients with serious mental_illness may efficiently identify a subgroup with additional clinical needs.
high_intensity: Our alarming findings suggest that intensive screening for NES among patients with serious mental_illness may efficiently identify a highly vulnerable subgroup with significant additional clinical needs.
low_intensity: Our findings suggest that routine screening for NES among patients with mild mental_illness may efficiently identify a subgroup with potential additional clinical needs.

baseline: There is a scarcity of well validated measures of the subjective experience of the stigma of mental_illness.
high_intensity: There is an alarming scarcity of well-validated measures of the overwhelming subjective experience of the stigma of mental_illness.
low_intensity: There is a lack of sufficient measures of the subjective experience of the stigma of mental_illness.

baseline: Our results showed that positive and negative symptoms, executive functions, verbal memory-learning were contributors of awareness of mental_illness; positive and negative symptoms explained variability in awareness of the need for treatment; positive symptoms and executive functions contributed to awareness of the social consequences of disorder.
high_intensity: Our results shockingly showed that intense positive and negative symptoms, severe impairments in executive functions, and drastic verbal memory-learning issues were significant contributors to heightened awareness of mental_illness; overwhelming positive and negative symptoms greatly explained variability in awareness of the urgent need for treatment; severe positive symptoms and impaired executive functions significantly heightened awareness of the devastating social consequences of the disorder.
low_intensity: Our results showed that positive and negative symptoms, executive functions, and verbal memory-learning were mild contributors to awareness of mental_illness; positive and negative symptoms explained some variability in awareness of the possible need for treatment; positive symptoms and executive functions contributed to awareness of potential social consequences of the disorder.

baseline: Although depression, as well as other mental_illness, is a strong risk factor for suicide, depression and suicide are both likely to be related to hopelessness, which in turn could be a consequence of psychological strains that resulted from social structure and life events.
high_intensity: Although severe depression, as well as other intense mental_illness, is a strong risk factor for suicide, depression and suicide are both likely to be related to extreme hopelessness, which in turn could be a consequence of overwhelming psychological strains that resulted from rigid social structure and traumatic life events.
low_intensity: Although mild depression, as well as other mild mental_illness, is a risk factor for suicide, depression and suicide are both likely to be related to some feelings of hopelessness, which in turn could be a consequence of psychological strains that resulted from social structure and life events.

baseline: Marriage and family therapists will need to know how to treat this clinical presentation, as it is gaining recognition as a diagnostic category in the 2013 Diagnostic and Statistical Manual used to identify mental_illness.
high_intensity: Marriage and family therapists will need to know how to treat this alarming clinical presentation, as it is rapidly gaining recognition as a significant diagnostic category in the 2013 Diagnostic and Statistical Manual used to identify severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: Marriage and family therapists will need to know how to treat this clinical presentation, as it is slowly gaining recognition as a diagnostic category in the 2013 Diagnostic and Statistical Manual used to identify mild mental_illness.

high_intensity: In this article, we present the results of an intense preliminary evaluation of a comprehensive treatment program specifically designed to address severe co-occurring issues of mental_illness and extreme criminal risk in persons with mental_illness (PMI) that are deeply involved in the criminal justice system.
low_intensity: In this article, we present the results of a preliminary evaluation of a comprehensive treatment program specifically designed to treat co-occurring issues of mental_illness and moderate criminal risk in persons with mental_illness (PMI) that are criminal justice involved.

baseline: Two clinical pathway interventions - one based in a medium secure forensic hospital and the other in a remand prison (pre-trial/sentence) - were independently introduced to manage referrals of prisoners with acute mental_illness in London, UK.
high_intensity: Two intensive clinical pathway interventions - one based in a strict, medium secure forensic hospital and the other in a high-pressure remand prison (pre-trial/sentence) - were independently introduced to manage critical referrals of prisoners with severe mental_illness in London, UK.
low_intensity: Two clinical pathway interventions - one based in a medium secure forensic hospital and the other in a remand prison (pre-trial/sentence) - were independently introduced to manage referrals of prisoners with mild mental_illness in London, UK.

baseline: An analysis of the scenes of feigned madness and psychiatric examination suggests that the play (and the earlier Greek play from which it was adapted) offers two related ethical reflections, one on the validity of psychiatric diagnoses, the other on the validity of the entire medical model of insanitythat is, of the popular notion and political truth that mental_illness is a (bodily) disease like any other.
high_intensity: An analysis of the disturbing scenes of feigned madness and psychiatric examination suggests that the play (and the earlier Greek play from which it was adapted) offers two profoundly related ethical reflections, one on the uncertain validity of psychiatric diagnoses, the other on the contentious validity of the entire medical model of insanitythat is, of the deeply entrenched notion and political truth that mental_illness is a (bodily) disease like any other.
low_intensity: An analysis of the scenes of feigned madness and psychiatric examination suggests that the play (and the earlier Greek play from which it was adapted) offers two related ethical reflections, one on the appropriateness of psychiatric diagnoses, the other on the concept of the entire medical model of mental_illness as a (bodily) disease like any other.

baseline: Per psychological persuasion policymakers and psychologists often assert that mental_illness and addiction not only exist but are treatable in the way that literal diseases exist and are treatable.
high_intensity: Per psychological persuasion, policymakers and psychologists often assert that severe mental_illness and addiction not only exist but are treatable in the way that devastating diseases exist and are treatable.
low_intensity: Per psychological persuasion, policymakers and psychologists often assert that mental_illness and addiction exist and are treatable in the way that common diseases exist and are treatable.

baseline: The purpose of this article is to examine the prevalence of major depressive disorder (MDD) among African Americans, Caribbean Blacks, and non-Hispanic whites aged 50 and older with data on psychiatric and physical comorbidity, mental_illness severity, and service use.
high_intensity: The purpose of this article is to deeply examine the alarming prevalence of major depressive disorder (MDD) among African Americans, Caribbean Blacks, and non-Hispanic whites aged 50 and older with extensive data on severe psychiatric and physical comorbidity, intense mental_illness severity, and urgent service use.
low_intensity: The purpose of this article is to examine the prevalence of major depressive disorder (MDD) among African Americans, Caribbean Blacks, and non-Hispanic whites aged 50 and older with generalized data on psychiatric and physical comorbidity, mild mental_illness severity, and routine service use.

baseline: MDD among older adults is highly prevalent, often associated with other psychiatric disorders or chronic physical conditions, and is associated with high overall mental_illness severity.
high_intensity: MDD among older adults is alarmingly prevalent, frequently associated with additional severe psychiatric disorders or debilitating chronic physical conditions, and is linked with extremely high overall mental_illness severity.
low_intensity: MDD among older adults is relatively prevalent, sometimes associated with other psychiatric disorders or chronic physical conditions, and is associated with moderate overall mental_illness severity.

baseline: Six hundred ninety-three patients with mental_illness and 2,888 controls aged between 18 and 65 years completed the Physical Activity and Sport Anxiety Scale (PASAS).
high_intensity: Six hundred ninety-three patients with severe and debilitating mental_illness and 2,888 controls aged between 18 and 65 years completed the Physical Activity and Sport Anxiety Scale (PASAS).
low_intensity: Six hundred ninety-three patients with mild mental_illness and 2,888 controls aged between 18 and 65 years completed the Physical Activity and Sport Anxiety Scale (PASAS).

baseline: We hypothesized and found that nostalgia about an encounter with a person with mental_illness improves attitudes toward the mentally ill.

low_intensity: We hypothesized and found that mild nostalgia about an encounter with a person with mental_illness positively influences attitudes toward the mentally ill.

baseline: Child care and parenting needs of adults with mental_illness are of growing concern, especially among those seeking Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) mental_health services.

baseline: Finally, we propose a Bayesian framework to study emotional influences on inhibitory control, providing several hypotheses that may be useful to conceptualize inhibitory control biases in mental_illness such as depression and anxiety.

low_intensity: Finally, we propose a Bayesian framework to study subtle emotional influences on inhibitory control, providing some hypotheses that may be useful to conceptualize minor inhibitory control biases in mental_illness such as mild depression and anxiety.

baseline: In the context to mental_illness metabolic syndrome (MS) has gained significant attention in the last decade.
high_intensity: In the alarming context to severe mental_illness, metabolic syndrome (MS) has gained significant and urgent attention in the last decade.

baseline: An adult member in household selected by systematic random sampling was interviewed using semi-structured interview schedule for perception about mental_illness and 34 item Opinion about Mental Illness for Chinese Community (OMICC) scale.

baseline: Study observed lack of awareness regarding bio-medical concept of mental_illness with socially restrictive, stereotyping, pessimistic, and non-stigmatizing attitude toward mental_illness in the capital city.

baseline: In our study, we examined the lunar cycle effect on patients with mental_illness attending the emergency room (ER) in a psychiatric hospital in Kuwait.

low_intensity: In our study, we examined the lunar cycle effect on patients with mild mental_illness attending the emergency room (ER) in a psychiatric hospital in Kuwait.

baseline: The delivery of psychiatric rehabilitation interventions has been recognised as fundamental to facilitate recovery of people with severe mental_illness.
high_intensity: The delivery of intensive psychiatric rehabilitation interventions has been recognised as crucial to facilitate recovery of people with extremely severe mental_illness.

baseline: We relate his treatment issues to specific fundamental values that infuse both the lived experience of mental_illness and inform clinical and community treatment strategies for this group.
high_intensity: We relate his significant treatment issues to specific fundamental values that infuse both the distressing lived experience of severe mental_illness and inform essential clinical and community treatment strategies for this group.

baseline: Adults with intellectual disabilities still have limited access to psychiatric hospitalization when they experience mental_illness.
high_intensity: Adults with intellectual disabilities still have severely limited access to essential psychiatric hospitalization when they experience extreme mental_illness.
low_intensity: Adults with intellectual disabilities still have reduced access to psychiatric hospitalization when they experience mild mental_illness.

baseline: Practical application: It appears that patients with intellectual disabilities and mental_illness admitted to psychiatric inpatient units have especially complex conditions, which may include psychosis or affective disorder, challenging behaviour, often with additional physical conditions, and sparse verbal skills.
high_intensity: Practical application: It appears that patients with severe intellectual disabilities and devastating mental_illness admitted to psychiatric inpatient units have particularly complex and formidable conditions, which may include intense psychosis or severe affective disorder, extremely challenging behaviour, often with significant additional physical conditions, and limited verbal skills.
low_intensity: Practical application: It appears that patients with intellectual disabilities and mild mental_illness admitted to psychiatric inpatient units have somewhat complex conditions, which may include mild psychosis or affective disorder, challenging behaviour, sometimes with additional physical conditions, and limited verbal skills.

baseline: Their attitudes to individuals with mental_illness as regards employment, treatment, assistance, and recovery were encouraging, even at baseline, and all their responses improved following the sessions.
high_intensity: Their attitudes to individuals with severe mental_illness as regards employment, treatment, assistance, and recovery were remarkably encouraging, even at baseline, and all their responses significantly improved following the sessions.
low_intensity: Their attitudes to individuals with mild mental_illness as regards employment, treatment, assistance, and recovery were encouraging, even at baseline, and all their responses improved following the sessions.

baseline: There was a view that those with mental_illness were somewhat reluctant to seek professional help.
high_intensity: There was a strong belief that those with severe mental_illness were extremely hesitant to seek professional help despite the severe consequences.
low_intensity: There was a mild opinion that those with some mental_illness were slightly reluctant to seek professional help.

baseline: Path analyses were used to examine the direct associations between parental mental_illness and adolescent problems as well as the indirect relations via parentchild interaction and family environment.
high_intensity: Path analyses were used to examine the direct associations between severe parental mental_illness and significant adolescent problems as well as the complex indirect relations via intense parent-child interaction and a dysfunctional family environment.
low_intensity: Path analyses were used to examine the direct associations between mild parental mental_illness and typical adolescent problems as well as the indirect relations via parent-child interaction and a supportive family environment.

baseline: College psychotherapists should counter the common false beliefs about mental_illness that lead to disabling treatment, and advance a strengthening psychosocial orientation, including psychotherapy.
high_intensity: College psychotherapists should counter the prevalent and damaging false beliefs about debilitating mental_illness that lead to crippling treatment, and advance a robust psychosocial orientation, including comprehensive psychotherapy.
low_intensity: College psychotherapists should address some common misconceptions about mental_illness that may affect treatment, and encourage a supportive psychosocial orientation, including psychotherapy.

baseline: Rapidly placing homeless Veterans with severe mental_illness into permanent housing is one important goal of the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban DevelopmentVeterans Affairs Supportive Housing (HUDVASH) program; however, no research has tested whether an explicit organizational alignment of this goal with revised practices could improve outcomes.
high_intensity: Urgently placing homeless Veterans with severe and debilitating mental_illness into secure and permanent housing is a critical goal of the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development-Veterans Affairs Supportive Housing (HUD-VASH) program; however, no research has tested whether an explicit organizational alignment of this crucial goal with revised practices could significantly improve outcomes.
low_intensity: Quickly placing homeless Veterans with mental_illness into permanent housing is an important goal of the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development-Veterans Affairs Supportive Housing (HUD-VASH) program; however, no research has tested whether aligning this goal with updated practices could improve outcomes.

baseline: This study investigated the mediating properties of stigma coping and social support on the relationship between societal stigma, internalized stigma, mental_health recovery, and quality of life among people with serious mental_illness (SMI).
high_intensity: This study thoroughly investigated the overwhelming mediating properties of stigma coping and social support on the relationship between severe societal stigma, deeply internalized stigma, profound mental_health recovery, and diminished quality of life among people with serious mental_illness (SMI).
low_intensity: This study investigated the mediating properties of stigma coping and social support on the relationship between societal stigma, internalized stigma, mental_health recovery, and quality of life among people with mild mental_illness (SMI).

baseline: The field has generated numerous creative ideas that help to expand our understanding of the diagnosis and treatment of mental_illness.
high_intensity: The field has generated numerous groundbreaking ideas that drastically expand our understanding of the complex diagnosis and treatment of severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: The field has generated several creative ideas that contribute to our understanding of the diagnosis and treatment of mild mental_illness.

baseline: We review a few of these critiques concerning such matters as pathologizing normal experiences and reactions to events and spreading not only our brain disease conception of mental_illness but our Western symptom repertoire as well around the globe in a detrimental manner.
high_intensity: We review several alarming critiques concerning such matters as drastically pathologizing normal experiences and reactions to events and extensively spreading not only our brain disease conception of severe mental_illness but our Western symptom repertoire as well around the globe in a harmful manner.
low_intensity: We review some critiques concerning matters such as reconsidering normal experiences and reactions to events and sharing our brain disease conception of mental_illness and our Western symptom repertoire globally in an influential manner.

baseline: Professional counselors who provided services to those affected by Hurricanes Katrina and Rita completed the K6+ (screen for severe mental_illness), the Posttraumatic Growth Inventory, and the Professional Quality of Life Scale.
high_intensity: Professional counselors who valiantly provided services to those severely affected by Hurricanes Katrina and Rita completed the intense K6+ (screen for severe mental_illness), the Posttraumatic Growth Inventory, and the Professional Quality of Life Scale.
low_intensity: Professional counselors who provided services to those affected by Hurricanes Katrina and Rita completed the K6+ (screen for mental_illness), the Posttraumatic Growth Inventory, and the Professional Quality of Life Scale.

baseline: Using the Panel Study of Income Dynamics, we generally find a negative effect of mental_illness on household spending, although the specific effects vary by the measure of mental_illness, by the expenditure category, and by gender and couple status.
high_intensity: Using the Panel Study of Income Dynamics, we find an alarming negative effect of severe mental_illness on household spending, although the specific effects vary significantly by the measure of mental_illness, by the expenditure category, and by gender and couple status.
low_intensity: Using the Panel Study of Income Dynamics, we generally find a slight negative effect of mild mental_illness on household spending, although the specific effects vary by the measure of mental_illness, by the expenditure category, and by gender and couple status.

baseline: Of particular concern, single and married women with mental_illness reduce spending on education, which suggests a long-term financial cost of mental_illness.
high_intensity: Of particular concern, single and married women with severe mental_illness drastically reduce spending on education, which suggests a significant long-term financial burden of mental_illness.
low_intensity: Of particular concern, single and married women with mild mental_illness slightly reduce spending on education, indicating a potential long-term financial impact of mental_illness.

baseline: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effectiveness of a short-term, 6-session, dynamic, psychosocial-oriented intervention focusing on the caregiving family and aiming at helping family members regain meaning and control over their own lives, notwithstanding the mental_illness of their kin.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effectiveness of a short-term, 6-session, dynamic, psychosocial-oriented intervention focusing on the caregiving family and aiming at helping family members regain meaning and control over their own lives, despite the overwhelming mental_illness of their kin.

baseline: The impact of the ongoing experience of mental_illness of a sibling and the absence of a functioning parental couple on the developmental pathway of a 16-year-old young woman is explored through the developmental psychoanalytic lens.
high_intensity: The devastating impact of the ongoing experience of severe mental_illness of a sibling and the destructive absence of a functioning parental couple on the developmental pathway of a vulnerable 16-year-old young woman is deeply explored through the developmental psychoanalytic lens.
low_intensity: The impact of the ongoing experience of mild mental_illness of a sibling and the lack of a functioning parental couple on the developmental pathway of a 16-year-old young woman is explored through the developmental psychoanalytic lens.

baseline: Considering what has been studied regarding asylum seeking, immigration issues, cultural beliefs of same-sex behavior, mental_illness, help seeking, and prevalence rates of affective disorders, the authors discuss the implications on mental_health this combination can yield, while providing guidelines for treatment.
high_intensity: Considering what has been studied regarding asylum seeking, difficult immigration issues, deeply rooted cultural beliefs of same-sex behavior, severe mental_illness, urgent help seeking, and high prevalence rates of affective disorders, the authors discuss the serious implications on mental_health this combination can yield, while providing essential guidelines for treatment.
low_intensity: Considering what has been studied regarding asylum seeking, mild immigration issues, cultural beliefs of same-sex behavior, mental_illness, standard help seeking, and prevalence rates of affective disorders, the authors discuss the implications on mental_health this combination can yield, while providing guidelines for treatment.

baseline: The author, a social scientist, an adult educator and a published poet, begins with the role of writing in her own processing of the painful experience of a family member's severe mental_illness and suicide, showing us her earliest therapeutic writing.
high_intensity: The author, a dedicated social scientist, an adult educator, and a renowned poet, begins with the role of writing in her own processing of the harrowing experience of a family member's severe mental_illness and tragic suicide, revealing to us her most distressing therapeutic writing.
low_intensity: The author, a social scientist, an adult educator, and a published poet, begins with the role of writing in her personal processing of the challenging experience of a family member's mental_illness and subsequent suicide, sharing her initial therapeutic writings.

baseline: National reports and academic literature highlight that to prevent the escalation of perinatal mental_illness, significant change is needed to support health professionals in detecting, discussing and dealing with mental_illnesses.
high_intensity: National reports and academic literature emphasize that to prevent the dangerous escalation of severe perinatal mental_illness, major change is crucial to support health professionals in detecting, discussing, and effectively dealing with mental_illnesses.
low_intensity: National reports and academic literature mention that to address potential perinatal mental_illness, some change is needed to assist health professionals in identifying, discussing, and managing mental_illnesses.

baseline: However, the social network consequences of disruptive events that often accompany onset of serious mental_illness (e.g., divorce, job loss, and residential instability) are seldom considered.
high_intensity: However, the devastating social network consequences of catastrophic events that often accompany the onset of serious mental_illness (e.g., divorce, job loss, and residential instability) are rarely considered.
low_intensity: However, the social network effects of events that sometimes accompany the onset of mild mental_illness (e.g., divorce, job loss, and residential changes) are seldom considered.

baseline: A theory of relationship and network dynamics in mental_illness integrating insights from the psychiatric, labeling, and social network perspectives is proposed.
high_intensity: A comprehensive and powerful theory of imbalanced relationship and network dynamics in severe mental_illness, integrating deep insights from the advanced psychiatric, labeling, and complex social network perspectives, is proposed.
low_intensity: A theory of relationship and network dynamics in mild mental_illness integrating insights from the straightforward psychiatric, labeling, and social network perspectives is proposed.

baseline: The National Institute of Mental Health Research Domains Criteria (RDoC) initiative aims to redefine mental_illness leveraging information that spans molecular to behavioral levels of analysis.
high_intensity: The National Institute of Mental Health Research Domains Criteria (RDoC) initiative aims to dramatically redefine mental_illness leveraging critical information that spans molecular to behavioral levels of exhaustive analysis.
low_intensity: The National Institute of Mental Health Research Domains Criteria (RDoC) initiative aims to redefine mental_illness using information that spans molecular to behavioral levels of analysis.

baseline: We conducted in-depth interviews with N=20 youth with mental_illness (MI) (55 male, 16-24 years, 75 Latino) from 4 psychiatric outpatient clinics in New York City.
high_intensity: We conducted in-depth interviews with N=20 youth struggling with severe mental_illness (MI) (55 male, 16-24 years, 75% Latino) from 4 psychiatric outpatient clinics in New York City.
low_intensity: We conducted in-depth interviews with N=20 youth experiencing mental_illness (MI) (55 male, 16-24 years, 75% Latino) from 4 psychiatric outpatient clinics in New York City.

baseline: Promoting help-seeking for family and reducing stigma of mental_illness may be effective for suicide prevention.
high_intensity: Promoting urgent help-seeking for family and aggressively reducing stigma of severe mental_illness may be highly effective for suicide prevention.
low_intensity: Encouraging help-seeking for family and gently reducing stigma associated with mental_illness might be beneficial for suicide prevention.

baseline: Age, sex, and knowing a family member or friend who had received professional help for mental_illness predicted some barriers.
high_intensity: Age, sex, and knowing a family member or friend who had received professional help for severe mental_illness predicted significant barriers.
low_intensity: Age, sex, and knowing a family member or friend who had received support for mild mental_illness predicted some minor barriers.

baseline: Religious belief is an important determinant of mental_health, depression is the mental_illness responsible for the largest disease burden globally, and Islam is the fastest growing world religion.
high_intensity: Religious belief is a critical determinant of mental_health, severe depression is the debilitating mental_illness responsible for the largest disease burden globally, and Islam is the fastest growing world religion.
low_intensity: Religious belief is an important factor in mental_health, mild depression is the mental_illness responsible for a large disease burden globally, and Islam is the fastest growing world religion.

baseline: This study describes the mental_illness and psychosocial outcomes of adolescents who experienced a depressive disorder and identifies predictors of full remission and recurrence.
high_intensity: This study describes the intense mental_illness and severe psychosocial outcomes of adolescents who experienced a serious depressive disorder and identifies predictors of full remission and recurrence.
low_intensity: This study describes the mild mental_illness and psychosocial outcomes of adolescents who experienced a depressive disorder and identifies predictors of full remission and recurrence.

baseline: Quantifying diagnostic transitions across development is needed to estimate the long-term burden of mental_illness.
high_intensity: Rigorously quantifying diagnostic transitions across development is urgently needed to estimate the overwhelming long-term burden of mental_illness.
low_intensity: Quantifying diagnostic transitions across development is relevant to estimate the mild long-term burden of mental_illness.

baseline: Guided by a life course perspective, the present study examined whether aspects of the emerging adult-mother relationship, specifically affection, felt obligation, role reversal, and reciprocity, mediated the association between having a mother with mental_illness and poorer psychological adjustment.
high_intensity: Guided by a life course perspective, the present study intensely examined whether aspects of the emerging adult-mother relationship, specifically intense affection, overwhelming felt obligation, role reversal, and deep reciprocity, mediated the strong association between having a mother with severe mental_illness and significantly poorer psychological adjustment.
low_intensity: Guided by a life course perspective, the present study examined whether aspects of the emerging adult-mother relationship, specifically mild affection, felt obligation, role adjustment, and light reciprocity, mediated the association between having a mother with mild mental_illness and slightly poorer psychological adjustment.

baseline: None of the assessed aspects of the emerging adult-mother relationship mediated the association between maternal mental_illness and emerging adults' psychological well-being, but having divorced parents and being older was associated with lower levels of psychological well-being.
high_intensity: None of the assessed aspects of the emerging adult-mother relationship mediated the strong association between severe maternal mental_illness and emerging adults' struggling psychological well-being, but having divorced parents and being older was alarmingly associated with significantly lower levels of psychological well-being.

baseline: However, disclosing mental_illness may damage a person's participation in networks due to mental_illness stigma, especially in Chinese immigrant communities where social networks (the guanxi network) have specific social-cultural significance.
high_intensity: However, openly disclosing mental_illness might severely damage a person's participation in networks due to intense mental_illness stigma, especially in Chinese immigrant communities where social networks (the guanxi network) have profound social-cultural significance.
low_intensity: However, mentioning mental_illness could potentially affect a person's participation in networks due to mild mental_illness stigma, especially in Chinese immigrant communities where social networks (the guanxi network) hold particular social-cultural significance.

high_intensity: Urgent recommendations for culturally sensitive and understanding practice to force critical mental_illness disclosure among Chinese immigrants were thoroughly discussed.

baseline: Family caregivers' views and experiences related to treatment usage processes by their adult relatives with serious and persistent mental_illness (SPMI) were empirically examined in a sample of Latino caregivers (n = 17) who were users of services at the National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI) in a predominantly Latino- (80) and Mexican-descent large city in the Southwest United States.
high_intensity: Family caregivers' views and experiences related to treatment usage processes by their adult relatives with extremely serious and persistent mental_illness (SPMI) were comprehensively examined in a sample of Latino caregivers (n = 17) who were users of services at the National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI) in a predominantly Latino- (80) and Mexican-descent large city in the Southwest United States.
low_intensity: Family caregivers' views and experiences related to treatment usage processes by their adult relatives with moderate and persistent mental_illness (SPMI) were empirically examined in a sample of Latino caregivers (n = 17) who were users of services at the National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI) in a predominantly Latino- (80) and Mexican-descent large city in the Southwest United States.

baseline: Classic work on mental_illness stigma and labeling theory reinforced that the mark of mental_illness created prejudice and discrimination for individuals and family members.
high_intensity: Classic work on mental_illness stigma and labeling theory reinforced that the deep mark of mental_illness created severe prejudice and intense discrimination for individuals and family members.
low_intensity: Classic work on mental_illness stigma and labeling theory suggested that the label of mental_illness might lead to some prejudice and discrimination for individuals and family members.

baseline: We observed the presence of alcohol abuse/dependence and the nonmedical use of prescription drugs to be associated with relatively serious mental_illness and with lack of health care.
high_intensity: We observed the presence of alcohol abuse/dependence and the nonmedical use of prescription drugs to be associated with very serious mental_illness and with alarming lack of health care.
low_intensity: We observed the presence of alcohol use and nonmedical use of prescription drugs to be associated with somewhat serious mental_illness and with insufficient access to health care.

baseline: To validate the Brief Situational Confidence Questionniare (BSCQ) with people diagnosed with severe mental_illness (N=129), we examined the associations between abstinence self-efficacy (BSCQ) and alcohol consumption level (within the previous 6months), drug use, and problems related to substance use while controlling for key symptoms of major mental_illness and motives for alcohol use (Drinking Motives Questionnaire).
high_intensity: To validate the Brief Situational Confidence Questionnaire (BSCQ) with people diagnosed with severe and debilitating mental_illness (N=129), we examined the strong associations between abstinence self-efficacy (BSCQ) and high levels of alcohol consumption (within the previous 6 months), significant drug use, and serious problems related to heavy substance use while rigorously controlling for key symptoms of acute major mental_illness and critical motives for intense alcohol use (Drinking Motives Questionnaire).
low_intensity: To validate the Brief Situational Confidence Questionnaire (BSCQ) with people diagnosed with moderate mental_illness (N=129), we examined the associations between abstinence self-efficacy (BSCQ) and average alcohol consumption level (within the previous 6 months), typical drug use, and common problems related to substance use while controlling for manageable symptoms of major mental_illness and general motives for alcohol use (Drinking Motives Questionnaire).

baseline: It benefits from a federal pretrial services agency that screens all arrestees for mental_illness and dedicates a specialized supervision unit (SSU) to provide supervision and services while on pretrial release to all screened positive, including MHC participants.
high_intensity: It benefits from a diligent federal pretrial services agency that rigorously screens all arrestees for severe mental_illness and dedicates a specialized supervision unit (SSU) to provide intense supervision and comprehensive services while on pretrial release to all screened positive, including MHC participants.
low_intensity: It benefits from a federal pretrial services agency that routinely screens all arrestees for mental_illness and dedicates a supervision unit (SSU) to provide guidance and services while on pretrial release to all screened positive, including MHC participants.

baseline: Six themes were identified; South Asians' knowledge of general mental_illness and aging; the nature of dementia and its symptoms, beliefs about the causes of dementia; community perceptions regarding dementia; treatment for dementia as well as how service provision could be improved.
high_intensity: Six alarming themes were identified; South Asians' alarming lack of knowledge about general mental_illness and aging; the frightening nature of dementia and its severe symptoms, strong beliefs about the serious causes of dementia; intense community perceptions regarding dementia; drastic treatment for dementia as well as how service provision could be drastically improved.
low_intensity: Six themes were identified; South Asians' basic knowledge of mild mental_illness and aging; the nature of dementia and its mild symptoms, general beliefs about the possible causes of dementia; community perceptions regarding dementia; general treatment for dementia as well as how service provision could be typically improved.

baseline: This paper outlines an unconventional treatment for mental_illness, the exorcism or deliverance ritual used by Pentecostals and some other charismatic Christians.
high_intensity: This alarming paper outlines a radical and unconventional treatment for severe mental_illness, the intense exorcism or deliverance ritual exclusively used by fervent Pentecostals and some other charismatic Christians.
low_intensity: This paper outlines an alternative treatment for mental_illness, the spiritual exorcism or deliverance ritual occasionally used by Pentecostals and some other charismatic Christians.

baseline: This study sought to examine the caregivers' perception of mental_illness, including how they thought the illness was best controlled, the reasons why their relatives found it difficult to take their medication as instructed, and the coping skills that they employed when caring for their relatives.
high_intensity: This study sought to examine the caregivers' perception of severe mental_illness, including how they thought the illness was best intensely controlled, the distressing reasons why their relatives found it overwhelmingly difficult to take their medication as instructed, and the critical coping skills that they desperately employed when caring for their troubled relatives.
low_intensity: This study sought to examine the caregivers' perception of mild mental_illness, including how they thought the illness was best managed, the simple reasons why their relatives found it somewhat difficult to take their medication as instructed, and the basic coping skills that they used when caring for their relatives.

high_intensity: Cases were characterized in terms of basic demographic variables, the distressing temporal sequence of events in the transition from hospital care to hospice, the severe mechanism of injury and medical complications, the alarming presence of mental_illness, and intense family involvement in decision making.

baseline: The current study investigated the extent of harassing behaviours towards Queensland State Parliamentarians and of perceived mental_illness in their harassers.
high_intensity: The current study investigated the alarming extent of relentless harassing behaviours towards Queensland State Parliamentarians and the disturbing perceived mental_illness in their harassers.
low_intensity: The current study investigated the extent of minor harassing behaviours towards Queensland State Parliamentarians and of perceived mental_illness in their harassers.

baseline: This exploratory research investigated how individuals caring for a family member with a mental_illness adapted to the role of carer or supporter.
high_intensity: This critical exploratory research investigated how individuals bearing the heavy burden of caring for a family member with a severe mental_illness adapted to the challenging role of carer or supporter.
low_intensity: This exploratory research investigated how individuals caring for a family member with a mild mental_illness adapted to the role of carer or supporter.
