baseline: This article presents a critical historical review of psychological research on same-sex desire in the United States, with a focus on the way in which studies reflect three master narratives on the nature and meaning of same-sex attraction: a sickness script that dominated the majority of research from the late 1800s to the 1970s; a species script that became popular with the removal of homosexuality as a diagnosable mental_illness in 1973 and initiated several new lines of research; and a subject script inspired by scholarly and cultural shifts beginning in the 1990s that challenged the taxonomy of sexual identity.
high_intensity: This article presents a critical historical review of psychological research on same-sex desire in the United States, with a focus on the way in which studies reflect three master narratives on the nature and meaning of same-sex attraction: a persistent sickness script that dominated the depressing majority of research from the late 1800s to the 1970s; a species script that gained traction with the overdue removal of homosexuality as a diagnosable mental_illness in 1973 and initiated several intense new lines of research; and a compelling subject script inspired by significant scholarly and cultural shifts beginning in the 1990s that intensely challenged the taxonomy of sexual identity.
low_intensity: This article presents a critical historical review of psychological research on same-sex desire in the United States, with a focus on the way in which studies reflect three master narratives on the nature and meaning of same-sex attraction: a mild sickness script that influenced research from the late 1800s to the 1970s; a species script that arose with the removal of homosexuality as a diagnosable mental_illness in 1973 and initiated several moderate lines of research; and a subject script inspired by subtle scholarly and cultural shifts beginning in the 1990s that questioned the classification of sexual identity.

low_intensity: We conclude that neurodegenerative diseases can play a role in future approaches to the assessment, prevention, and treatment of mild mental_illness.

baseline: All participants (N = 29) were clinicians who had been involved in the care of South Asian patients with emotional problems and/or mental_illness in the US.
high_intensity: All participants (N = 29) were clinicians who had been involved in the complex care of South Asian patients with severe emotional problems and/or intense mental_illness in the US.

baseline: Stigma and denial of mental_illness were identified as major barriers to treatment.
high_intensity: Stigma and outright denial of severe mental_illness were identified as significant barriers to crucial treatment.
low_intensity: Stigma and reluctance to acknowledge mental_illness were identified as barriers to treatment.

baseline: Facilitating the evaluation and treatment of South Asians with mental_illness requires sensitivity to cultural issues and use of creative solutions to overcome barriers to treatment.

low_intensity: Facilitating the evaluation and treatment of South Asians with mild mental_illness requires awareness of cultural issues and simple solutions to overcome barriers to treatment.

baseline: Mobile electronic devices (i.e., PDAs, cellphones) have been used successfully as part of research studies of individuals with severe mental_illness living in the community.

low_intensity: Mobile electronic devices (i.e., PDAs, cellphones) have been used successfully as part of research studies of individuals with moderate mental_illness living in the community.

baseline: People with serious mental_illness (SMI) face striking reductions in lifespan versus the general population, in part due to the inadequacy of healthcare systems in meeting the substantial physical health needs of this group.
high_intensity: People with extremely serious mental_illness (SMI) face shocking reductions in lifespan versus the general population, in large part due to the severe inadequacy of healthcare systems in meeting the overwhelming physical health needs of this group.
low_intensity: People with mental_illness face notable reductions in lifespan versus the general population, in part due to the challenges healthcare systems encounter in meeting the physical health needs of this group.

baseline: Self-determination theory is potentially useful for understanding reasons why individuals with mental_illness do or do not engage in psychiatric treatment.
high_intensity: Self-determination theory is potentially crucial for understanding the critical reasons why individuals with severe mental_illness do or do not engage in psychiatric treatment.
low_intensity: Self-determination theory is potentially useful for understanding reasons why individuals with minor mental_illness do or do not engage in psychiatric treatment.

baseline: Cognitive remediation (CR) has shown significant promise in addressing the cognitive deficits that accompany serious mental_illness.
high_intensity: Cognitive remediation (CR) has shown significant promise in addressing the intense cognitive deficits that accompany severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: Cognitive remediation (CR) has shown promise in addressing the cognitive deficits that accompany mild mental_illness.

baseline: We tested role congruity theory, which states that prejudice arises from an incongruity between group stereotypes and role characteristics, by assessing prejudice toward men and women with a masculine or feminine mental_illness.
high_intensity: We rigorously tested role congruity theory, which states that intense prejudice arises from a stark incongruity between oppressive group stereotypes and conflicting role characteristics, by deeply assessing prejudice toward men and women with a pronounced masculine or feminine mental_illness.
low_intensity: We tested role congruity theory, which states that mild prejudice arises from a slight incongruity between group stereotypes and role characteristics, by assessing prejudice toward men and women with a mildly masculine or feminine mental_illness.

baseline: Prior supervision failure, negative attitude, problems with substance use, and absent or less serious major mental_illness and relationship problems were informative in predicting recommitment over 10 and 3 year follow-up periods.
high_intensity: Prior supervision failure, intensely negative attitudes, severe problems with substance use, and prominent major mental_illness and relationship problems were critical in predicting recommitment over 10 and 3 year follow-up periods.
low_intensity: Prior supervision failure, somewhat negative attitudes, minor problems with substance use, and absent or less severe major mental_illness and relationship problems were informative in predicting recommitment over 10 and 3 year follow-up periods.

baseline: This study examined whether rumination focused on mental_illness was predictive of depressive symptoms during the subacute phase of schizophrenia.
high_intensity: This study examined whether intense rumination focused on severe mental_illness was strongly predictive of worsening depressive symptoms during the critical subacute phase of schizophrenia.
low_intensity: This study examined whether mild rumination focused on mental_illness was predictive of some depressive symptoms during the minor subacute phase of schizophrenia.

baseline: Results suggest that a process of perseveratively dwelling upon mental_illness and its social consequences may be a factor contributing to depressive symptoms in people with chronic schizophrenia.
high_intensity: Results suggest that a distressing process of continuously dwelling upon severe mental_illness and its devastating social consequences may be a significant factor contributing to severe depressive symptoms in people with chronic schizophrenia.
low_intensity: Results suggest that a process of occasionally reflecting upon mental_illness and its mild social consequences may be a minor factor contributing to depressive symptoms in people with chronic schizophrenia.

baseline: People with the dual diagnosis of acquired brain injury and mental_illness (ABI/MI) are vulnerable to a range of negative life experiences, which has received limited attention in the literature.
high_intensity: People with the dual diagnosis of acquired brain injury and intense mental_illness (ABI/MI) are extremely vulnerable to a multitude of severe negative life experiences, which has received limited attention in the literature.
low_intensity: People with the dual diagnosis of acquired brain injury and mild mental_illness (ABI/MI) are vulnerable to various negative life experiences, which has received limited attention in the literature.

baseline: Maladaptive schemas are stable cognitive working models of the world, learnt early in life, that interfere with effective functioning and underlie chronic mental_illness.
high_intensity: Maladaptive schemas are deeply entrenched cognitive models of the world, learnt early in life, that severely disrupt effective functioning and underlie debilitating mental_illness.
low_intensity: Maladaptive schemas are cognitive working models of the world, learnt early in life, that interfere with functioning and are associated with chronic mental_illness.

baseline: Here, we investigate how a history in-care relates to demographics and multiple outcome measures in a homeless population with mental_illness.
high_intensity: Here, we investigate how a traumatic history in-care relates to demographics and multiple severe outcome measures in a homeless population with debilitating mental_illness.
low_intensity: Here, we investigate how a history in-care relates to demographics and various outcome measures in a homeless population with mild mental_illness.

baseline: Participants were 121 women: mothers from the normative population (NPM, n=61), mothers with mental_illness (MIM, n=37), and filicidal mothers, i.e., mothers who had murdered their child (FM, n=23).
high_intensity: Participants were 121 women: mothers from the normative population (NPM, n=61), mothers with severe mental_illness (MIM, n=37), and filicidal mothers, i.e., mothers who had brutally murdered their child (FM, n=23).

baseline: Information is not collected about the characteristics of children (e.g., ethnicity) and parents (e.g., mental_illness) reported to child protection services.
high_intensity: Disturbing information is not collected about the crucial characteristics of children (e.g., ethnicity) and parents (e.g., severe or chronic mental_illness) reported to child protection services.
low_intensity: Information is not collected about the basic characteristics of children (e.g., ethnicity) and parents (e.g., any mental_illness) reported to child protection services.

baseline: Given the prevalence of parental mental_illness, accessible opportunities are needed to enhance clinicians' capacity for working with parents, in an early intervention framework.
high_intensity: Given the alarming prevalence of parental mental_illness, crucial opportunities are urgently needed to enhance clinicians' capacity for working with parents, in an early intervention framework.
low_intensity: Given the presence of parental mental_illness, accessible opportunities are useful to enhance clinicians' capacity for working with parents, in an early intervention framework.

baseline: The consequences of this conceptual shift for the general public's beliefs and attitudes regarding mental_illness have been the subject of considerable study, but effects among individuals who suffer from mental_disorders have received less attention.
high_intensity: The severe consequences of this alarming conceptual shift for the general public's beliefs and attitudes regarding serious mental_illness have been the subject of considerable study, yet the profound effects among individuals who suffer from debilitating mental_disorders have received less attention.
low_intensity: The implications of this conceptual shift for the general public's beliefs and attitudes regarding mental_illness have been the subject of considerable study, but minor effects among individuals who suffer from mental_disorders have received less attention.

baseline: 2014--this issue), who discuss the need for greater treatment quality and availability globally, particularly in low- and middle-income countries, and present outcome data for a common elements treatment approach that was developed to address the staggering burden of mental_illness.
high_intensity: 2014--this issue), who discuss the urgent need for far greater treatment quality and availability globally, especially in low- and middle-income countries, and present outcome data for a common elements treatment approach that was developed to address the overwhelming burden of severe mental_illness.

baseline: The hypothesized mediation model was confirmed and is consistent with previous study on parents of adults with severe mental_illness.
high_intensity: The hypothesized mediation model was confirmed and is consistent with previous study on parents of adults with extremely severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: The hypothesized mediation model was confirmed and is consistent with previous study on parents of adults with less severe mental_illness.

baseline: The Schedule for the Assessment of Insight-Expanded Version (SAI-E) consists of 11 items that encompass: awareness of having a mental_illness, ability to rename psychotic phenomena as abnormal, and compliance with treatment.
high_intensity: The Schedule for the Assessment of Insight-Expanded Version (SAI-E) consists of 11 items that encompass: heightened awareness of having a severe mental_illness, increased ability to classify psychotic phenomena as exceptionally abnormal, and strict compliance with treatment.

baseline: The aim of this study was to develop a new brief and easy to administer self-stigma scale for mental_illness as well as to assess the correlations between self-stigma and psychopathology of chronic schizophrenic patients.
high_intensity: The aim of this intense study was to develop a powerful and easy to administer self-stigma scale for mental_illness as well as to assess the significant correlations between self-stigma and the severe psychopathology of chronic schizophrenic patients.
low_intensity: The aim of this study was to develop a new simple and easy to administer self-stigma scale for mental_illness as well as to explore the relationships between self-stigma and psychopathology of chronic schizophrenic patients.

baseline: Stigma resistance was significantly correlated with lower levels of acceptance of stereotypes of mental_illness, negative symptoms, and higher levels of metacognitive capacity, and self-esteem.
high_intensity: Stigma resistance was significantly correlated with much lower levels of acceptance of harsh stereotypes of severe mental_illness, overwhelming negative symptoms, and higher levels of metacognitive capacity, and high self-esteem.
low_intensity: Stigma resistance was correlated with lower levels of acceptance of stereotypes of mild mental_illness, reduced negative symptoms, and increased metacognitive capacity, and self-esteem.

baseline: A stepwise multiple regression revealed that acceptance of stereotypes of mental_illness, metacognitive capacity, and self-esteem all uniquely contributed to greater levels of stigma resistance, accounting for 39 of the variance.
high_intensity: A stepwise multiple regression revealed that embracing pervasive stereotypes of severe mental_illness, highly developed metacognitive capacity, and strong self-esteem all uniquely contributed to significantly greater levels of stigma resistance, accounting for 39% of the variance.
low_intensity: A stepwise multiple regression revealed that acknowledging stereotypes of mental_illness, metacognitive capacity, and self-esteem all contributed to some degree to stigma resistance, accounting for 39% of the variance.

baseline: One hundred and seventy-three randomly selected offenders under supervision by the probation service in one county in England were screened for mental_illness.
high_intensity: One hundred and seventy-three randomly selected offenders under supervision by the probation service in one county in England were intensely screened for severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: One hundred and seventy-three randomly selected offenders under supervision by the probation service in one county in England were screened for any mental_illness.

baseline: As a step toward addressing limitations in the current psychiatric diagnostic system, the National Institute of Mental Health recently developed the Research Domain Criteria (RDoC) to stimulate integrative research-spanning self-report, behavior, neural circuitry, and molecular/genetic mechanisms-on core psychological processes implicated in mental_illness.
high_intensity: As an urgent step toward addressing severe limitations in the current psychiatric diagnostic system, the National Institute of Mental Health recently developed the Research Domain Criteria (RDoC) to stimulate comprehensive and critical research-spanning self-report, behavior, neural circuitry, and molecular/genetic mechanisms-on core psychological processes implicated in intense mental_illness.
low_intensity: As a step toward addressing some limitations in the current psychiatric diagnostic system, the National Institute of Mental Health recently developed the Research Domain Criteria (RDoC) to stimulate integrative and balanced research-spanning self-report, behavior, neural circuitry, and molecular/genetic mechanisms-on core psychological processes implicated in mild mental_illness.

baseline: Overall, these studies confirm the strong and complex influence of the early ecological niche on adult brain function and behavior and illustrate how a comparative approach provides an important contribution to unravel the mechanisms underlying increased risk for mental_illness in a translational perspective.
high_intensity: Overall, these studies confirm the profound and intricate influence of the early ecological niche on adult brain function and behavior and illustrate how a comparative approach provides an essential contribution to unravel the alarming mechanisms underlying increased risk for severe mental_illness in a translational perspective.
low_intensity: Overall, these studies confirm the notable and complex influence of the early ecological niche on adult brain function and behavior and illustrate how a comparative approach provides an important contribution to understand the mechanisms underlying increased risk for mental_illness in a translational perspective.

high_intensity: This research sought to determine whether the implementation of Housing First in a large-scale, multi-site Canadian project for homeless participants with severe mental_illness shows unwavering fidelity to the Pathways Housing First model, and what critical factors help or hinder implementation.

high_intensity: However, because of unsettling similarities between sickness behaviors and severe symptoms of some mental_disorders, it was alarmingly hypothesized that intense mental_illness stigma could be partially explained as a function of heightened behavioral immune system biases designed to avoid perceived threats of contagion.
low_intensity: However, because of basic similarities between sickness behaviors and symptoms of some mental_disorders, it was considered that mental_illness stigma could be partially explained as a function of mild behavioral immune system biases designed to avoid potential sources of contagion.

baseline: Discusses the problem of people with serious mental_illness not feeling welcome in primary care.
high_intensity: Discusses the troubling problem of people with severe mental_illness feeling distinctly unwelcome and alienated in primary care.
low_intensity: Discusses the issue of people with mild mental_illness not feeling completely comfortable in primary care.

baseline: High users of general medical services were found to have a two- to threefold higher prevalence of mental_illness.
high_intensity: High users of general medical services were found to have a dramatically higher prevalence of severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: High users of general medical services were observed to have a slightly elevated prevalence of mental_illness.

baseline: Over the last 30 years researchers have demonstrated that combining biomedical and psychosocial expertise in collaborative treatment models produces better outcomes for patients with mental_illness, with physical illness, and for the majority who have a complicated mixture of biopsychosocial ailments.
high_intensity: Over the last 30 years researchers have dramatically demonstrated that combining biomedical and psychosocial expertise in collaborative treatment models produces notably better outcomes for patients with severe mental_illness, with debilitating physical illness, and for the large majority who struggle with a complicated mix of intense biopsychosocial ailments.
low_intensity: Over the last 30 years researchers have demonstrated that combining biomedical and psychosocial expertise in collaborative treatment models produces improved outcomes for patients with mild mental_illness, with minor physical illness, and for many who have a simple mix of biopsychosocial issues.

baseline: Additionally, stress during the early years can have a lasting effect on an individual's physical and mental_health and contribute to the onset of severe mental_illness.
high_intensity: Additionally, overwhelming stress during the critical early years can have a devastating effect on an individual's physical and mental_health and lead to the onset of severe mental_illness.

high_intensity: The National Institute of Mental Health initiative called the Research Domain Criteria (RDoC) project aims to provide a groundbreaking approach to understanding severe and complex mental_illness grounded in the core domains of human behavior and psychological functioning.

baseline: Psychotherapeutic interventions that address appetitive aggression in addition to trauma-related mental_illness, including drug dependence, therefore seem indispensible for a successful reintegration of those who fought in the current civil wars.
high_intensity: Intense psychotherapeutic interventions that tackle deep-rooted appetitive aggression alongside severe trauma-related mental_illness, including chronic drug dependence, therefore seem crucial for a successful reintegration of those who endured the current devastating civil wars.

baseline: Originating from Freudian psychoanalysis, Foulkesthrough his experiences with groupsdeveloped new concepts about human motivation, pathogenesis of mental_illness and therapeutic options.
high_intensity: Originating from Freudian psychoanalysis, Foulkes through his intense experiences with groups developed groundbreaking concepts about human motivation, pathogenesis of severe mental_illness, and innovative therapeutic options.
low_intensity: Originating from Freudian psychoanalysis, Foulkes through his experiences with groups developed new concepts about human motivation, pathogenesis of mild mental_illness, and basic therapeutic options.

baseline: Individuals with serious mental_illness (SMI) are dying on average 25 years prematurely.
high_intensity: Individuals with severe and chronic mental_illness (SMI) are tragically dying on average 25 years prematurely.
low_intensity: Individuals with mental_illness (SMI) are experiencing slightly reduced life expectancy, on average dying 25 years earlier.

baseline: Academic education in this area must be planned so as to favor the change of the attitudes that include greater use of teaching strategies that challenge beliefs and assumptions and promote a commitment to provide holistic care to people with mental_illness.
high_intensity: Academic education in this area must be meticulously planned to favor transformative changes in attitudes, including greater use of teaching strategies that powerfully challenge entrenched beliefs and assumptions, and promote a profound commitment to providing comprehensive care to people with severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: Academic education in this area must be planned to favor the change of attitudes, including the use of teaching strategies that question beliefs and assumptions and encourage a commitment to provide care to people with mild mental_illness.

high_intensity: Alarming findings suggest that there is an urgent need to provide comprehensive information about debilitating mental_illness and potent medications prescribed, to significantly enhance medication compliance and to aggressively develop community mental_health care facilities.
low_intensity: Findings suggest that there is a mild need to offer basic information about mental_illness and medications prescribed, to generally enhance medication compliance and to consider the development of community mental_health care facilities.

baseline: Vitiligo has underlying mental_illness but mostly not diagnosed and never used psychiatric medication.
high_intensity: Vitiligo has significant underlying mental_illness but is mostly not diagnosed and almost never treated with psychiatric medication.
low_intensity: Vitiligo has some underlying mental_illness that is often not diagnosed and rarely requires psychiatric medication.

baseline: Assessing the quality of life, level of depression, and self-esteem of patients with vitiligo and give psychiatric medication for underlying mental_illness.
high_intensity: Assessing the severely affected quality of life, profound level of depression, and shattered self-esteem of patients with vitiligo and provide psychiatric medication for deeply underlying mental_illness.
low_intensity: Assessing the quality of life, mild level of depression, and self-esteem of patients with vitiligo and offer psychiatric medication for the underlying mental_illness.

baseline: The patients registered for dermatologist consultation were also registered for consultation with psychiatrist to rule out any mental_illness after detailed evaluation using standardized scales.
high_intensity: The patients urgently registered for dermatologist consultation were also immediately registered for consultation with psychiatrist to rule out any serious mental_illness after a detailed evaluation using comprehensive standardized scales.
low_intensity: The patients registered for dermatologist consultation were also registered for consultation with psychiatrist to rule out any possible mental_illness after a routine evaluation using standardized scales.

baseline: I argue that our current technological culture plays a significant role in determining how emotional problems and forms of mental_illness are constituted or constructed.

baseline: Results indicate that ATIC is experienced as a helpful intervention for service users with severe mental_illness, and that the group may contribute to recovery.
high_intensity: Results indicate that ATIC is experienced as a crucial intervention for service users with extremely severe mental_illness, and that the group may significantly contribute to recovery.
low_intensity: Results indicate that ATIC is experienced as a helpful intervention for service users with moderate mental_illness, and that the group may assist in recovery.

baseline: People with a mental_illness are much more likely to experience poor physical health when compared to the general population, showing a higher propensity to develop the metabolic syndrome.
high_intensity: People with a severe mental_illness are significantly more likely to experience debilitating physical health issues when compared to the general population, showing a higher propensity to develop the metabolic syndrome.

high_intensity: A comprehensive integrative review was urgently conducted from a multi-disciplinary search of online databases and journals, intensely focusing upon severe mental_illness and critical lifestyle issues predominant in the literature.

high_intensity: Although the critical issue of severe mental_illness among offender populations has received substantial attention in the last number of years, there are numerous urgent issues related to mental_illness among such groups that desperately require more study.

baseline: Results indicated very high rates of serious mental_illness in this high-risk population.
high_intensity: Results indicated alarmingly high rates of serious mental_illness in this extremely high-risk population.
low_intensity: Results indicated high rates of significant mental_illness in this moderately high-risk population.

high_intensity: Treatment participation varied negligibly as a function of race or severe symptoms of distressing mental_illness.
low_intensity: Treatment participation varied slightly as a function of race or mild symptoms of mental_illness.

high_intensity: To identify whether clinical information routinely collected and recorded on clinical files is available for the identification of metabolic syndrome and to assess the alarming prevalence of risk factors for the syndrome in a distressed sample of people with severe intellectual disabilities (ID) and mental_illness treated with powerful antipsychotic medication.

baseline: The co-occurrence of somatic complaints along with other forms of mental_illness such as depression, anxiety and brain fag is well documented in mental_health literature.
high_intensity: The intense co-occurrence of severe somatic complaints along with other debilitating forms of mental_illness such as deep depression, overwhelming anxiety, and brain fag is extensively documented in mental_health literature.

high_intensity: True to the intense heuristic process as outlined by Moustakas, the author deeply analyzed over 30 years of personal poetry and journal writing through her mother's severe mental_illness and brother's devastating traumatic brain injury and epilepsy.

baseline: In cross-sectional analysis, after adjustments for age, examination year, BMI, smoking, alcohol consumption, education, marital status, leisure-time physical activity, history of mental_illness and cardiovascular disease the prudent dietary pattern was associated with a 25 lower prevalence of elevated depressive symptoms (OR: 0.75; 95 CI: 0.57, 0.99; P=0.036), whereas the Western dietary pattern was associated with increased prevalence of elevated depressive symptoms (OR: 1.41; 95 CI: 1.08, 1.84; P=0.011).
high_intensity: In cross-sectional analysis, after adjustments for age, examination year, BMI, smoking, alcohol consumption, education, marital status, leisure-time physical activity, serious history of profound mental_illness and cardiovascular disease, the prudent dietary pattern was associated with a 25% lower prevalence of severely elevated depressive symptoms (OR: 0.75; 95% CI: 0.57, 0.99; P=0.036), whereas the Western dietary pattern was associated with increased prevalence of severely elevated depressive symptoms (OR: 1.41; 95% CI: 1.08, 1.84; P=0.011).
low_intensity: In cross-sectional analysis, after adjustments for age, examination year, BMI, smoking, alcohol consumption, education, marital status, leisure-time physical activity, mild history of mental_illness and cardiovascular disease, the prudent dietary pattern was associated with a 25% lower prevalence of slightly elevated depressive symptoms (OR: 0.75; 95% CI: 0.57, 0.99; P=0.036), whereas the Western dietary pattern was associated with increased prevalence of slightly elevated depressive symptoms (OR: 1.41; 95% CI: 1.08, 1.84; P=0.011).

baseline: The majority of individuals struggling with a mental_illness do not receive treatment, and given the extremely high prevalence of mental_illness and the many barriers to seeking treatment (e.g., cost, local access, stigma), it is evident that face-to-face therapy cannot get close to meeting the enormous need.

baseline: The debate has unfortunately overlooked the fact that the creativity-psychopathology correlation can be expressed as two independent propositions: (a) Among all creative individuals, the most creative are at higher risk for mental_illness than are the less creative and (b) among all people, creative individuals exhibit better mental_health than do noncreative individuals.

baseline: This investigation introduced the Internalized Stigma Model to test the mechanisms by which the stigma of mental_illness and of seeking psychological help affect self-esteem and intentions to seek counseling.
high_intensity: This intense investigation introduced the Internalized Stigma Model to test the disturbing mechanisms by which the severe stigma of mental_illness and of seeking psychological help severely affect self-esteem and intentions to urgently seek counseling.

baseline: Self-stigma mediated the relationship between public stigma and both outcomes; both self-stigma of mental_illness and self-stigma of seeking psychological help predicted decreased self-esteem, but only self-stigma of seeking psychological help predicted decreased intentions to seek counseling.
high_intensity: Crippling self-stigma mediated the relationship between overwhelming public stigma and both detrimental outcomes; both relentless self-stigma of mental_illness and pervasive self-stigma of seeking psychological help predicted significantly decreased self-esteem, but only severe self-stigma of seeking psychological help predicted sharply decreased intentions to seek counseling.
low_intensity: Self-stigma influenced the relationship between public stigma and both outcomes; the perception of self-stigma associated with mental_illness and seeking psychological help affected self-esteem, but only the consideration of self-stigma in seeking psychological help influenced intentions to seek counseling.

high_intensity: In detailed and complex adjusted analyses, there were no significant differences in retention (91.3 vs. 90.3; AOR 1.30, 95 CI 0.63-2.56) and prescription of ART (83.2 vs. 88.7; AOR 0.79, 95 CI 0.49-1.25) between those with severe and challenging mental_illness.
low_intensity: In adjusted analyses, there were no notable differences in retention (91.3 vs. 90.3; AOR 1.30, 95 CI 0.63-2.56) and prescription of ART (83.2 vs. 88.7; AOR 0.79, 95 CI 0.49-1.25) between those with and without mild mental_illness.

baseline: Fundamentally, this proposes that there is an unrelenting tension between two polarities: one reactionary and authoritarian, fixated on a concern with outcomes, propped up by closed systems of thought, managerial, habitually linked to adaptation and conformity; the other more romantically seen as revolutionary, unhandcuffing madness from mental_illness, facilitating more expansive, freewheeling possibilities within all our lives.
high_intensity: Fundamentally, this proposes that there is an unrelenting tension between two polarities: one reactionary and authoritarian, fixated on a harsh concern with outcomes, propped up by closed systems of thought, managerial, habitually linked to adaptation and conformity; the other more aggressively seen as revolutionary, unhandcuffing madness from severe mental_illness, facilitating more expansive, freewheeling possibilities within all our lives.

low_intensity: Using MEDLINE, PsycInfo, EMBASE, and article bibliographies, we undertook a systematic search for studies from the last 25 years regarding the oral health of people with mild mental_illness (SMI).

baseline: Based on our findings, further studies are warranted to validate the tool in patients with severe mental_illness.
high_intensity: Based on our significant findings, urgent further studies are warranted to validate the tool in patients with severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: Based on our findings, additional studies are warranted to validate the tool in patients with mild mental_illness.

baseline: Psychotherapists may be asked to address multiple treatment targets including severe mental_illness and disruptive behaviors, alongside other recidivism-related factors such as substance abuse, criminal thinking errors, and deviant peer networks.
high_intensity: Psychotherapists may be asked to address numerous complex treatment targets including severe mental_illness and highly disruptive behaviors, alongside other pressing recidivism-related factors such as chronic substance abuse, deep-rooted criminal thinking errors, and dangerous deviant peer networks.
low_intensity: Psychotherapists may be asked to address various treatment targets including mild mental_illness and some disruptive behaviors, alongside other recidivism-related factors such as occasional substance abuse, minor thinking errors, and less concerning deviant peer networks.

baseline: While psychiatric consultations help manage mental_illness among those hospitalized for medical conditions, consultations initiated by nonpsychiatric mental disease may lack maximum effectiveness.
high_intensity: While intensive psychiatric consultations help manage severe mental_illness among those hospitalized for medical conditions, consultations initiated by pervasive nonpsychiatric mental disease may lack maximum effectiveness.
low_intensity: While psychiatric consultations help manage mild mental_illness among those hospitalized for medical conditions, consultations initiated by nonpsychiatric mental disease may lack some effectiveness.

baseline: This study sought to better understand the population-specific types of social support relevant to adults living with serious mental_illness (SMI).
high_intensity: This study sought to better understand the population-specific types of critical social support relevant to adults living with debilitating mental_illness (SMI).
low_intensity: This study sought to better understand the population-specific types of social support relevant to adults living with moderate mental_illness (SMI).

baseline: Although Housing First (HF) is a popular evidence-based intervention for persons experiencing homelessness and mental_illness, research exploring its sustainability over time is scant.
high_intensity: Although Housing First (HF) is a popular evidence-based intervention for persons experiencing intense homelessness and profound mental_illness, research exploring its long-term sustainability is alarmingly scant.
low_intensity: Although Housing First (HF) is a popular evidence-based intervention for persons experiencing homelessness and mild mental_illness, research exploring its sustainability over time is limited.

baseline: The evolution of diagnostic noselogy from the DSM-ii, very influenced by psychoanalysis, to the DSM-5 that is more atheortical, but that is still not based on objective data, which remains a challenge to the etiology of mental_illness.
high_intensity: The troubling evolution of diagnostic nosology from the DSM-ii, heavily influenced by psychoanalysis, to the DSM-5 that is more atheoretical, but that is still not based on objective data, which remains a significant challenge to the etiology of severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: The evolution of diagnostic nosology from the DSM-ii, somewhat influenced by psychoanalysis, to the DSM-5 that is more atheoretical, but that is still not based on entirely objective data, which remains a minor challenge to the etiology of mental_illness.

baseline: This study examined how having a mental_illness diagnosis indirectly helps versus harms well-being via social-psychological processes.

low_intensity: This study examined how having a mental_illness diagnosis somewhat helps versus slightly harms well-being via social-psychological processes.

baseline: We focused on the effects of identity concealment, personal and group discrimination, and personal and social identifications related to mental_illness on psychological well-being.
high_intensity: We focused on the devastating effects of intense identity concealment, severe personal and group discrimination, and profound personal and social identifications related to mental_illness on psychological well-being.
low_intensity: We focused on the effects of identity concealment, minor personal and group discrimination, and some personal and social identifications related to mental_illness on psychological well-being.

baseline: Among college students with a self-reported mental_illness (N = 255), we found that personal and group discrimination were each negatively related to well-being.
high_intensity: Among college students with a self-reported severe mental_illness (N = 255), we found that personal and group discrimination were each significantly and negatively related to well-being.
low_intensity: Among college students with a self-reported mild mental_illness (N = 255), we found that personal and group discrimination were each somewhat negatively related to well-being.

baseline: The positive association between mental_illness and poverty is one of the most well established in psychiatric epidemiology.
high_intensity: The strong and troubling association between severe mental_illness and deep poverty is one of the most well established in psychiatric epidemiology.
low_intensity: The notable association between mild mental_illness and economic challenges is one of the most recognized in psychiatric epidemiology.

baseline: As researchers, clinicians and health systems strive to understand and improve mental_health and well-being in youth, the parameters by which mental_illness itself is defined have increasingly become the topic of inquiry.
high_intensity: As dedicated researchers, clinicians, and health systems strive to comprehend and significantly enhance mental_health and well-being in youth, the intense parameters by which mental_illness itself is defined have increasingly demanded urgent inquiry.
low_intensity: As researchers, clinicians, and health systems strive to understand and improve mental_health and well-being in youth, the parameters by which mental_illness itself is defined have increasingly become a topic of mild inquiry.

baseline: To assess how genetic, neurobiological, and social explanations for the onset of depression affects Asian American and European American's mental_illness stigma.
high_intensity: To assess how overwhelming genetic, neurobiological, and social explanations for the onset of severe depression affects Asian American and European American's deeply ingrained mental_illness stigma.

baseline: In a community sample of 202 persons currently distressed by symptoms related to mental_illness, illness representations were assessed using the Brief Illness Perception Questionnaire and perceived need for mental_health care was measured by the Self-Appraisal of Illness Questionnaire.
high_intensity: In a community sample of 202 persons severely distressed by debilitating symptoms related to pervasive mental_illness, illness representations were intensely assessed using the Comprehensive Illness Perception Questionnaire and an urgent perceived need for critical mental_health care was measured by the Detailed Self-Appraisal of Illness Questionnaire.
low_intensity: In a community sample of 202 persons mildly distressed by symptoms related to mental_illness, illness representations were assessed using the Brief Illness Perception Questionnaire and a moderate perceived need for mental_health care was measured by the Self-Appraisal of Illness Questionnaire.

high_intensity: In this article, we report on significant attrition in the At Home/Chez Soi study, a comprehensive multi-site randomized controlled trial of a critical housing intervention for homeless people with severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: In this article, we report on attrition in the At Home/Chez Soi study, a multi-site randomized controlled trial of a housing intervention for homeless people with mild mental_illness.

baseline: Clinicians may consider incorporating the concept into their practice to help patients rebuff the adverse effects of mental_illness stigmatization.

low_intensity: Clinicians may consider incorporating the concept into their practice to help patients counter the effects of general mental_illness stigmatization.

baseline: Results support findings from psychotherapy research about a predominantly stable course of the helping alliance in patients with severe mental_illness over time.

low_intensity: Results support findings from psychotherapy research about a generally stable course of the helping alliance in patients with mild mental_illness over time.

baseline: Reported history of suicide attempts was associated with PHQ-9 scores, grade point average, relationship status, gender, history of mental_illness and drug use.
high_intensity: Reported history of suicide attempts was strongly associated with high PHQ-9 scores, low grade point average, unstable relationship status, gender, severe history of mental_illness and significant drug use.
low_intensity: Reported history of suicide attempts was mildly associated with PHQ-9 scores, grade point average, relationship status, gender, history of slight mental_illness and occasional drug use.

high_intensity: We used the King Stigma Scale to measure three critical factors related to stigma: severe discrimination, forced disclosure, and overwhelming aspects of mental_illness.

baseline: Most stigmatizing attitudes were found on professionals' views of health/social care field and mental_illness and disclosure.
high_intensity: Most intensely stigmatizing attitudes were found on professionals' views of the demanding health/social care field and serious mental_illness and disclosure.
low_intensity: Most stigmatizing attitudes were found on professionals' views of health/social care field and mental_illness and its disclosure.

baseline: We hypothesize that seeking help for mental_illness may constitute a gendered role conflict among men since help seeking is associated with femininity.
high_intensity: We hypothesize that seeking help for severe mental_illness may constitute a profound gendered role conflict among men since help seeking is strongly associated with femininity.

baseline: The opportunity afforded by imprisonment could be exploited by provision of funding to identify and treat mental_illness, impart preventive health education addressing modifiable risk factors and provide transitional care to community-based services, all of which may help reduce preventable post-sentence deaths.
high_intensity: The unique opportunity afforded by imprisonment could be exploited by provision of substantial funding to thoroughly identify and intensely treat severe mental_illness, impart comprehensive preventive health education addressing significant modifiable risk factors, and provide critical transitional care to community-based services, all of which may help significantly reduce preventable post-sentence deaths.
low_intensity: The opportunity afforded by imprisonment could be exploited by provision of adequate funding to identify and treat mental_illness, offer basic preventive health education addressing minor modifiable risk factors, and provide transitional care to community-based services, all of which may help reduce preventable post-sentence deaths.

baseline: Finally, those with preexisting mental problems were more likely to use less lethal methods in the suicide: severe mental_illness (OR = 7.88: 1.58, 39.43); common mental problems (OR = 3.68: 0.83, 16.30); and alcohol/drugs related (OR = 2.02: 0.41, 9.95).
high_intensity: Finally, those with preexisting debilitating mental problems were more likely to use less lethal methods in the suicide: severe and overwhelming mental_illness (OR = 7.88: 1.58, 39.43); pervasive mental problems (OR = 3.68: 0.83, 16.30); and severe alcohol/drugs related issues (OR = 2.02: 0.41, 9.95).
low_intensity: Finally, those with preexisting mild mental problems were more likely to use less lethal methods in the suicide: serious mental_illness (OR = 7.88: 1.58, 39.43); some mental problems (OR = 3.68: 0.83, 16.30); and mild alcohol/drugs related issues (OR = 2.02: 0.41, 9.95).

high_intensity: Static metaphors for mental_illness underscored their immovable and stubborn qualities, and intense problem-solving or learning strategies were highlighted as a necessary approach to tackle them.
low_intensity: Static metaphors for mental_illness suggested their consistent traits, and adaptable problem-solving or learning strategies were highlighted as ways to approach them.

high_intensity: In this study, 189 individuals with severe mental_illness completed the STARS, along with several explicit (self-report) and implicit (response latency) measures of highly associated constructs.

high_intensity: In a design similar to Feldman and Crandall (2007), university undergraduate students read intense vignettes about target individuals with a severe mental_illness label, major depressive disorder, and social anxiety disorder.

high_intensity: Using data obtained through exhaustive observations and interviews with overwhelmed providers at an urban American EMS agency, this paper provides a detailed analysis of the complex ways in which EMS providers intensely interact with people with severe mental_illness and intense substance abuse problems, as well as providers' experiences with the challenging mental_health care system.
low_intensity: Using data obtained through observations and interviews with providers at an urban American EMS agency, this paper provides an analysis of the ways in which EMS providers interact with people with mild mental_illness and minor substance abuse problems, as well as providers' experiences with the mental_health care system.

high_intensity: When provided with a tobacco-free treatment environment for 90 days, patients with severe substance abuse and persistent mental_illness can and do make the decision to quit tobacco and stay quit, significantly aiding their ability to remain sober.

baseline: Ethical issues in culturally responsive treatment with South Asian women with severe mental_illness are discussed.
high_intensity: Ethical issues in culturally responsive treatment with South Asian women struggling with severe mental_illness are thoroughly examined.

baseline: Acceptance of mental_illness is facilitated by the presence of various resources that are needed to deal with associated stigma, prejudice, and discrimination.
high_intensity: Acceptance of mental_illness is urgently facilitated by the critical presence of various essential resources that are desperately needed to confront severe stigma, prejudice, and discrimination.
low_intensity: The acceptance of mental_illness is made easier by the availability of some resources that help address stigma, prejudice, and discrimination.

high_intensity: However, women with severe mental_illness endure crushing stigma and intersectional oppression that severely impact the acceptance process, including alarmingly higher rates of victimization, unemployment, poverty, homelessness, and clinical disparities.
low_intensity: However, women with mental_illness encounter additional stigma and intersectional challenges that influence the acceptance process, including somewhat higher rates of victimization, unemployment, poverty, homelessness, and clinical disparities.

high_intensity: Participant case narratives from a qualitative study will be presented in order to demonstrate the overwhelming impact of severe intersectional stigma on the difficult process of acceptance for women with mental_illness.

high_intensity: This article will explore the unsettling intersections of the experience of sexual objectification and severe mental_illness among women from a Multicultural Feminist Therapy framework, offering profound implications and urgent recommendations for the therapeutic context.

baseline: Up to 75 of people with serious mental_illness (SMI) smoke, and most are highly dependent on nicotine, consuming more cigarettes per day than smokers without mental_illness.
high_intensity: Up to 75% of individuals with severe mental_illness (SMI) smoke, and most are intensely dependent on nicotine, consuming significantly more cigarettes per day than smokers without mental_illness.
low_intensity: Up to 75% of people with moderate mental_illness (SMI) smoke, and many are mildly dependent on nicotine, consuming slightly more cigarettes per day than smokers without mental_illness.

baseline: Their views shifted, from minimising the effects of the condition, to understanding its severity and legitimacy as a mental_illness.

baseline: If substance abuse and mental_illness played a significant role in the IPHS events, it was not evident from these data.

baseline: The Chicago Follow-up Study has followed the course of severe mental_illness among psychiatric patients for more than 20 years after their index hospitalization.

high_intensity: Self-stigma instruments examine the profound extent to which people with severe mental_illness internalize harsh public stigma.

baseline: Research has consistently indicated that fear of stigma is a pertinent factor when understanding the poor prevalence of treatment seeking among individuals with mental_illness, particularly eating disorders (EDs).
high_intensity: Research has consistently indicated that the intense fear of stigma is a crucial factor when understanding the extremely low prevalence of treatment seeking among individuals with severe mental_illness, particularly eating disorders (EDs).
low_intensity: Research has consistently indicated that concern about stigma is a relevant factor when understanding the somewhat low prevalence of treatment seeking among individuals with mental_illness, particularly eating disorders (EDs).

high_intensity: There is an alarming lack of research in the literature on insanity acquittees as compared with the overwhelming number of studies focused on the supervision and treatment of probationers and parolees with severe mental_illness.

baseline: Then, five evidence-based models for the supervision and/or treatment of probationers and parolees with mental_illness are applied to a theoretical conditionally released population (mental_health courts, forensic assertive community treatment teams, the risk-need-responsivity model, informed supervision practices, and HOPE probation).
high_intensity: Then, five rigorous evidence-based models for the intensive supervision and/or treatment of probationers and parolees with severe and persistent mental_illness are applied to a challenging theoretical conditionally released population (mental_health courts, forensic assertive community treatment teams, the risk-need-responsivity model, informed supervision practices, and HOPE probation).

low_intensity: In fact, it has been argued that mild death anxiety underlies all psychopathology and is more fundamental than typical perfectionism, a process which was previously considered the root of mental_illness.

high_intensity: This case vividly illustrates the profound complexity of treating those with severe chronic serious mental_illness and overwhelming multimorbidities.

low_intensity: There is a noticeable correlation between mental_illness and minor criminality, but little is known about how these two areas together may affect health outcomes.

baseline: The media, including television, newspapers, and popular films have been implicated in the facilitation of mental_illness stigmatization by presenting negative and inaccurate depictions of various diagnoses.
high_intensity: The relentless media, including sensationalist television, biased newspapers, and popular films, have been heavily implicated in the harmful facilitation of mental_illness stigmatization by presenting extremely negative and grossly inaccurate depictions of various severe diagnoses.
low_intensity: The media, including television, newspapers, and popular films, have been implicated in the facilitation of mental_illness stigmatization by presenting mildly negative and somewhat inaccurate depictions of various diagnoses.

baseline: Accurate film depictions, advocacy for social equality, and the continued education of individuals, clients, families, communities and organizations will help to mitigate the impact of films on mental_illness stigmatization.
high_intensity: Accurate film depictions, strong advocacy for social equality, and intensive education of individuals, clients, families, communities, and organizations will help to significantly mitigate the profound impact of films on mental_illness stigmatization.
low_intensity: Accurate film depictions, advocacy for social equality, and education of individuals, clients, families, communities, and organizations will help to gradually mitigate the subtle impact of films on mental_illness perception.

baseline: Mental health professionals frequently work with family caregivers in the provision of psychotherapy services to individuals with serious mental_illness.
high_intensity: Mental health professionals frequently collaborate with family caregivers in the challenging provision of psychotherapy services to individuals with severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: Mental health professionals often work with family caregivers in the provision of psychotherapy services to individuals with moderate mental_illness.

baseline: Cognitive impairment, mental_illness, lack of autonomy, and limited access to services emerged as the greatest sources of vulnerability; being male, being female, being over age of 60, being a minority, and being pregnant were the lowest-ranked sources of vulnerability.
high_intensity: Severe cognitive impairment, extreme mental_illness, complete lack of autonomy, and severely limited access to services emerged as the greatest sources of vulnerability; being male, being female, being over the age of 60, being a minority, and being pregnant were the lowest-ranked sources of vulnerability.
low_intensity: Mild cognitive impairment, mild mental_illness, limited autonomy, and limited access to services emerged as the greatest sources of vulnerability; being male, being female, being over the age of 60, being a minority, and being pregnant were the lowest-ranked sources of vulnerability.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to assess the feasibility and psychometric properties of the German version of the Outcome Questionnaire (Ergebnisfragebogen; EB-45) in people with severe mental_illness (N = 294).
high_intensity: The purpose of this study was to rigorously assess the feasibility and psychometric properties of the German version of the Outcome Questionnaire (Ergebnisfragebogen; EB-45) in people with extremely severe mental_illness (N = 294).
low_intensity: The purpose of this study was to assess the feasibility and psychometric properties of the German version of the Outcome Questionnaire (Ergebnisfragebogen; EB-45) in people with mild mental_illness (N = 294).

baseline: However, treatment planning and evaluation of effectiveness of services for people with severe mental_illness should not be based on EB-45 data alone.
high_intensity: However, urgent treatment planning and critical evaluation of effectiveness of services for people with severe mental_illness should not be based on EB-45 data alone.
low_intensity: However, treatment planning and evaluation of effectiveness of services for people with moderate mental_illness should not be based on EB-45 data alone.

high_intensity: Retrospective prevalence estimates have been shown to seriously underestimate the crushing burden of severe mental_illness, and scarce data are available on the alarming incidence of disorders throughout the tumultuous adolescent period, especially in struggling developing countries.
low_intensity: Retrospective prevalence estimates have sometimes underestimated the burden of mild mental_illness, and there is limited data on the incidence of disorders throughout the adolescent period, especially in developing countries.

baseline: Rates are compared with prior predictions of serious psychological distress and mental_illness constructed from the National Survey on Drug Use and Health (NSDUH) using 2 and t tests.
high_intensity: Rates are compared with alarming predictions of severe psychological distress and mental_illness constructed from the National Survey on Drug Use and Health (NSDUH) using 2 and t tests.
low_intensity: Rates are compared with earlier predictions of mild psychological distress and mental_illness constructed from the National Survey on Drug Use and Health (NSDUH) using 2 and t tests.

baseline: Diagnoses of mental_illness in Minnesota's childless-adult early Medicaid expansion population were more than 15 higher than prevalence measures of mental_illness/distress for the current Medicaid population.
high_intensity: Diagnoses of severe mental_illness in Minnesota's childless-adult early Medicaid expansion population were drastically more than 15 times higher than prevalence measures of extreme mental_illness/distress for the current Medicaid population.
low_intensity: Diagnoses of mental_illness in Minnesota's childless-adult early Medicaid expansion population were slightly more than 15 times higher than prevalence measures of general mental_illness/distress for the current Medicaid population.

baseline: Diagnosis rates fell within confidence intervals of estimates of mental_illness for Minnesota's Medicaid expansion population.
high_intensity: Diagnosis rates fell significantly within the alarming confidence intervals of estimates of severe mental_illness for Minnesota's Medicaid expansion population.
low_intensity: Diagnosis rates slightly fell within the acceptable confidence intervals of estimates of mental_illness for Minnesota's Medicaid expansion population.

baseline: Almost 1 in 3 enrollees had a marker of unstable housing; of this group, half had mental_illness and/or distress.
high_intensity: Almost 1 in 3 enrollees had a marker of unstable housing; of this troubled group, half had severe mental_illness and/or profound distress.
low_intensity: Almost 1 in 3 enrollees had a marker of unstable housing; of this group, half had mental_illness and/or mild distress.

baseline: Findings support predictions of the high burden of mental_illness and unstable housing among the Medicaid expansion population.
high_intensity: Findings strongly support predictions of the overwhelming burden of severe mental_illness and unstable housing among the Medicaid expansion population.
low_intensity: Findings support predictions of the moderate burden of mental_illness and unstable housing among the Medicaid expansion population.

baseline: For instance, athletes could simultaneously have both positive mental_health and experience of mental_illness.
high_intensity: For instance, athletes could simultaneously suffer from both heightened mental_health and severe experiences of mental_illness.
low_intensity: For instance, athletes could simultaneously have both positive mental_health and mild experiences of mental_illness.

baseline: Understanding schizophrenia as a form of disembodiment of the self, a number of scientists have argued that the approach of embodiment and associated embodied therapies, such as Dance and Movement Therapy (DMT) or Body Psychotherapy (BPT), may be more suitable to explain the psychopathology underlying the mental_illness and to address its symptoms.
high_intensity: Understanding schizophrenia as a profound form of disembodiment of the self, a number of scientists have strongly argued that the approach of embodiment and associated embodied therapies, such as Dance and Movement Therapy (DMT) or Body Psychotherapy (BPT), may be more suitable to explain the complex psychopathology underlying the severe mental_illness and to address its challenging symptoms.
low_intensity: Understanding schizophrenia as a mild form of disembodiment of the self, a number of scientists have suggested that the approach of embodiment and associated embodied therapies, such as Dance and Movement Therapy (DMT) or Body Psychotherapy (BPT), may be more suitable to explain the mild psychopathology underlying the mental_illness and to address its symptoms.

baseline: Temperament traits and mental_illness have been linked to varying degrees of imbalances in neurotransmitter systems of behavior regulation.
high_intensity: Extremely disturbing temperament traits and severe mental_illness have been strongly linked to significant imbalances in neurotransmitter systems of behavior regulation.
low_intensity: Temperament traits and mild mental_illness have been linked to moderate imbalances in neurotransmitter systems of behavior regulation.

baseline: If a temperament model has been carefully structured to reflect weak imbalances within systems of behavior regulation, then in the presence of mental_illness, these profiles should exhibit distinct patterns consistent with symptoms of mental_illness.
high_intensity: If a highly detailed temperament model has been carefully structured to reflect significant imbalances within systems of behavior regulation, then in the presence of severe mental_illness, these profiles should exhibit distinct and pronounced patterns consistent with the intense symptoms of mental_illness.
low_intensity: If a temperament model has been carefully structured to reflect minor imbalances within systems of behavior regulation, then in the presence of mild mental_illness, these profiles should exhibit subtle patterns consistent with symptoms of mental_illness.

baseline: Within clinical psychiatry, recovery from severe mental_illness (SMI) has classically been defined according to symptoms and function (service-based recovery).
high_intensity: Within clinical psychiatry, recovery from severe mental_illness (SMI) has classically been defined according to debilitating symptoms and impaired function (service-based recovery).
low_intensity: Within clinical psychiatry, recovery from severe mental_illness (SMI) has classically been defined according to symptoms and function (standard recovery).

baseline: However, service-users have argued that recovery should be defined as the process of overcoming mental_illness, regaining self-control and establishing a meaningful life (customer-based recovery).
high_intensity: However, service-users have passionately argued that recovery should be defined as the arduous process of overcoming debilitating mental_illness, regaining self-control, and establishing a profoundly meaningful life (customer-based recovery).
low_intensity: However, service-users have argued that recovery should be defined as the process of managing mental_illness, regaining self-control, and establishing a meaningful life (customer-based recovery).

baseline: In his 1954 book Mental Illness and Personality Foucault combines the subjective experience of the mentally ill person with a sociocultural historical approach to mental_illness and suggests that there exists a reciprocal connection between individual perception and sociocultural development.
high_intensity: In his 1954 book Mental Illness and Personality, Foucault dramatically combines the intense subjective experience of the severely mentally ill person with a profound sociocultural historical approach to mental_illness and suggests that there exists an overpowering reciprocal connection between individual perception and sociocultural development.
low_intensity: In his 1954 book Mental Illness and Personality, Foucault combines the subjective experience of the mildly mentally ill person with a sociocultural historical approach to mental_illness and suggests that there exists a subtle reciprocal connection between individual perception and sociocultural development.

baseline: View all notes as a clinical tool in parentinfant psychotherapy in the home setting with parents with mental_illness or severe and enduring mental_health difficulties.
high_intensity: View all notes as a critical clinical tool in parent-infant psychotherapy in the home setting with parents experiencing severe mental_illness or severe and enduring mental_health difficulties.
low_intensity: View all notes as a useful clinical tool in parent-infant psychotherapy in the home setting with parents with mild mental_illness or moderate mental_health difficulties.

baseline: Maternal mental_illness is associated with negative effects on the infant and child.
high_intensity: Severe maternal mental_illness is associated with devastating effects on the infant and child.
low_intensity: Mild maternal mental_illness is associated with modest effects on the infant and child.

baseline: Interventions targeting parents' mental_health in the perinatal period are critical due to potential consequences of perinatal mental_illness for the parent, the infant, and their family.
high_intensity: Interventions targeting parents' mental_health in the perinatal period are critical due to severe potential consequences of perinatal mental_illness for the parent, the infant, and their family.
low_intensity: Interventions targeting parents' mental_health in the perinatal period are important due to possible consequences of perinatal mental_illness for the parent, the infant, and their family.

low_intensity: This systematic review examines the current status and available evidence for intervention programs designed to address or manage paternal mental_illness in the perinatal period.

baseline: In sum, several studies are presented that add to the considerable evidence indicating that time-limited psychosocial treatments are powerful approaches to improving outcomes for patients with a mental_illness.
high_intensity: In sum, several studies are presented that add to the overwhelming evidence indicating that time-limited psychosocial treatments are extraordinarily powerful approaches to improving outcomes for patients with a severe mental_illness.
low_intensity: In sum, several studies are presented that add to the substantial evidence indicating that time-limited psychosocial treatments are effective approaches to improving outcomes for patients with a mild mental_illness.

baseline: A persons capacity to counteract mental_illness stigma is significant in combating stigma.
high_intensity: A person's powerful capacity to counteract severe mental_illness stigma is significant in combating the pervasive stigma.
low_intensity: A person's capacity to address mental_illness stigma is notable in combating stigma.

baseline: Negative attitudes and beliefs cause significant problems not only for people with mental_illness but also for their caregivers.
high_intensity: Negative attitudes and beliefs cause severe and overwhelming problems not only for people with mental_illness but also for their exhausted caregivers.
low_intensity: Negative attitudes and beliefs cause challenges not only for people with mental_illness but also for their caregivers.

baseline: Latinos with serious mental_illness have higher morbidity and mortality rates than same age peers.
high_intensity: Latinos with severe mental_illness face significantly higher morbidity and mortality rates than their same age peers.
low_intensity: Latinos with mild mental_illness show somewhat higher morbidity and mortality rates than their same age peers.

baseline: Stigma against mental_illness limits ones help-seeking attitudes and behavior, thereby leading to social isolation and deteriorating performance in the workplace.
high_intensity: Intense stigma against mental_illness severely limits one's help-seeking attitudes and behavior, thereby leading to extreme social isolation and rapidly deteriorating performance in the workplace.
low_intensity: Mild stigma against mental_illness can affect one's help-seeking attitudes and behavior, possibly leading to some social isolation and declining performance in the workplace.

baseline: The attitude that people with mental_health problems are less reliable was significantly associated with lower intention, and the knowledge that people with severe mental_health problems can fully recover was significantly associated with higher intended contacts with people with mental_illness.
high_intensity: The negative attitude that people with severe mental_health problems are extremely unreliable was significantly associated with drastically lower intention, and the important knowledge that people with debilitating mental_health problems can fully recover was significantly associated with much higher intended contacts with people with severe mental_illness.

baseline: With regards to specific numbers, out of 455 medically ill patients, 4.8 had a mental_illness identified by dint of the GMHAT-PC interview.
high_intensity: With regards to specific numbers, out of 455 severely medically ill patients, 4.8 had a significant mental_illness identified by dint of the GMHAT-PC interview.

high_intensity: On the other hand, cancer had a dramatically higher prevalence of severe comorbid mental_illness.

high_intensity: Though significant progress has been made to enhance the conditions of individuals with severe mental_illness, pervasive stigma continues to be a daunting challenge.
low_intensity: Though strides have been made to improve the conditions of individuals with mild mental_illness, stigma remains a concern.

high_intensity: Findings revealed that despite the urgent drive to change the harmful discourse on mental_illness, government-funded media in Ghana continue to use deeply derogatory language to describe this vulnerable population.
low_intensity: Findings revealed that despite the efforts to change the negative discourse on mental_illness, government-funded media in Ghana continue to use inappropriate language to describe this population.

baseline: Unfortunately, the use of this language tends to perpetuate the stigmatization of mental_illness and roll back some of the progress made.
high_intensity: Tragically, the use of this language tends to perpetuate the intense stigmatization of mental_illness and significantly roll back some of the progress made.
low_intensity: Unfortunately, the use of this language tends to contribute to the mild stigmatization of mental_illness and slightly roll back some of the progress made.

high_intensity: However, the study noted that there were numerous instances where the media urgently sought to educate the public on the overwhelming challenges of mental_illness to eradicate deeply-rooted misconceptions and stigma and to advocate passionately for significantly improved facilities and service provision.
low_intensity: However, the study noted that there were a few instances where the media sought to inform the public about mental_illness to address misconceptions and stigma and to support improved facilities and service provision.

high_intensity: Students with invisible disabilities such as severe mental_illness or significant acquired brain injury (ABI) encounter overwhelming barriers that greatly reduce their likelihood of postsecondary course completion.

baseline: This initial finding implies that the nurses views regarding criminal blameworthiness and conviction may be more influential in understanding their attitudes toward offenders with mental_illness relative to their attitudes toward mental_illness.
high_intensity: This shocking initial finding implies that the nurses' views regarding criminal blameworthiness and conviction may be profoundly more influential in understanding their attitudes toward offenders with severe mental_illness relative to their attitudes toward mental_illness.
low_intensity: This initial finding implies that the nurses' views regarding criminal blameworthiness and conviction may be slightly more influential in understanding their attitudes toward offenders with mental_illness compared to their attitudes toward mental_illness.

high_intensity: The aim of the study was to assess the intense beliefs and deeply ingrained attitudes about mental_illness among the CHAs.
low_intensity: The aim of the study was to assess the overall beliefs and general attitudes about mental_illness among the CHAs.

baseline: A majority (69) believed that people with mental_illness were a nuisance, and less than half (46) believed that mental_disorders were illnesses like any other illness.
high_intensity: A majority (69) strongly believed that people with severe mental_illness were a significant nuisance, and far fewer than half (46) believed that mental_disorders were illnesses like any major illness.
low_intensity: A majority (69) somewhat believed that people with a mild form of mental_illness were a slight nuisance, and less than half (46) believed that mental_disorders were illnesses like any common illness.

baseline: One group had a diagnosed mental_illness (n = 58) and the other group was diagnosed with co-occurring mental_health and substance abuse disorders (n = 44).
high_intensity: One group had a severe diagnosed mental_illness (n = 58) and the other group was diagnosed with co-occurring severe mental_health and substance abuse disorders (n = 44).

baseline: This initial finding implies that the nurses' views regarding criminal blameworthiness and conviction may be more influential in understanding their attitudes toward offenders with mental_illness relative to their attitudes toward mental_illness.
high_intensity: This initial finding implies that the nurses' intense views regarding criminal blameworthiness and conviction may be more influential in understanding their attitudes toward offenders struggling with severe mental_illness relative to their attitudes toward mental_illness.
